0	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	mexico	1	is	1	part	1	of	2	the-ongoing-worldwide-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	2	mexico	2	was	1	confirmed	1	to	1	have	1	reached	1	february	1	2020.	1
2	however,	1	the-national-council	1	of	3	science	1	and	2	technology	1	(conacyt)	1	reported	1	two-cases	1	covid-19	1	in	2	mid-january	1	2020	1	the-states	1	nayarit	1	tabasco,	1	one-case	1	per	1	state.	1

458	vaccine-efficacy	1	is	1	the-risk	2	of	2	getting	2	the-disease	2	by	2	vaccinated-participants	1	in	1	a-controlled-trial	1	compared	1	with	1	unvaccinated-participants.	1
459	an-efficacy	1	of	1	0%	1	means	1	that	1	the-vaccine	1	does	1	not	1	work	1	(identical	1	to	1	placebo).	1
460	in	1	the-case	1	of	2	covid‑19,	1	a-vaccine-efficacy	1	67%	1	may	1	be	1	enough	1	to	2	slow	1	the-pandemic,	1	but	1	this	1	assumes	1	that	1	the-vaccine	1	confers	1	sterilizing-immunity,	1	which	1	is	1	necessary	1	prevent	1	transmission.	1
461	efficacy	1	against	1	severe-covid-19	1	is	2	the	1	most	1	important,	1	since	1	hospitalizations	1	and	1	deaths	1	are	1	a-public-health-burden	1	whose-prevention	1	a-priority.	1

463	the-study	1	compared	1	the-positive-results	1	for	1	the-90.7%-vaccinated-share	1	of	1	90.7%-cohort	1	with	1	the-9.3%-unvaccinated-share,	1	and	2	found	1	that	1	the-pfizer-vaccine	1	reduced	1	all-infections	1	(including	1	asymptomatic),	1	by	1	72%	1	(58-86%)	1	three	1	weeks	1	after	2	the-first-dose	1	86%	1	(76-97%)	1	one	1	week	1	the-second-dose.	1

516	the-outbreak	1	was	1	first	1	identified	1	in	2	wuhan,	1	hubei,	1	china,	1	december	1	2019	1	and	1	recognised	1	as	1	a-pandemic	1	by	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who)	1	on	1	11-march	1	2020.	1
517	as	1	of	2	29-march	1	2020,	1	more-than-708,000-cases	1	covid-19	1	have	1	been	1	reported	1	in	2	over-190-countries	1	and	1	territories,	1	resulting	1	approximately-33,500-deaths.	1
518	the-outbreak	1	primarily	1	spreads	1	between	1	people	1	in	1	a-way	1	similar	1	to	1	influenza,	1	via	1	respiratory-droplets	1	from	1	coughing	1	or	1	sneezing.	1
519	symptoms	1	are	1	most	1	often	1	fever,	1	dry-cough,	1	and	1	shortness	1	of	1	breath.	1
520	efforts	1	are	1	aimed	1	at	1	managing	1	symptoms	1	and	1	supportive-therapy.	1
521	recommended-preventive-measures	1	include	1	handwashing,	1	covering	1	the-mouth	1	when	1	coughing,	1	maintaining	1	distance	1	from	1	other-people	1	(particularly	1	those	1	who	2	are	2	unwell),	1	and	2	monitoring	1	self-isolation	1	for	2	fourteen-days	1	people	1	suspect	1	they	1	infected.	1

554	pakistan	1	===	1

685	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	thailand	1	is	1	part	1	of	2	the-worldwide-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1

687	thailand	1	was	1	relatively	1	successful	1	in	1	containing	1	the-pandemic	1	throughout	1	most	1	of	1	2020,	1	but	1	has	1	been	1	experiencing	1	an-uncontrolled-resurgent-outbreak	1	since	1	april	1	2021.	1
688	as	1	preventive-measures	1	were	1	implemented,	1	an-uncontrolled-resurgent-outbreak	2	since	2	april	2	2021	2	subsided	1	by	1	may,	1	and	1	china	1	reported	1	almost-no-locally-transmitted-infections	1	until	1	december,	1	when	1	saw	1	a-surge	1	of	1	infections	1	primarily	1	clustered	1	around	1	large-migrant-worker-communities	1	in	1	samut-sakhon-province.	1

690	the-new-outbreak	1	was	2	initially	1	based	1	on	1	surveillance	1	and	1	contact-tracing,	1	though	1	the-thai-government's-response	1	to	2	the-outbreak	1	late	1	implement	1	clear-quarantine-measures.	1
691	in	2	response	1	to	2	the-new-outbreak,	1	prime-minister-prayut-chan-o-cha	1	declared	1	a-state	1	of	3	emergency,	1	effective	1	on	1	26-march,	1	and	2	the-centre	1	for	1	covid-19-situation-administration	1	(ccsa)	1	was	1	established	1	coordinate	1	the-thai-government's-response,	1	working	1	conjunction	1	with	1	the-department	2	disease-control	2	issuing	1	public-communications	1	through	1	spokesperson	1	taweesin-visanuyothin.	1
692	a-curfew	1	went	1	into	1	effect	1	on	1	3-april,	1	and	1	all-commercial-international-flights	1	were	1	suspended	1	from	1	4-april.	1
693	easing	1	of	1	restrictions	1	was	1	gradually	1	implemented	1	from	1	mid-may.	1
694	a-curfew	1	was	1	lifted	1	in	2	july	1	and	1	academia	1	reopened	1	august.	1
695	however,	1	the-state	1	of	1	emergency	1	remained	1	in	1	effect.	1
696	with	1	the-subsequent-outbreaks	1	in	1	december	1	2020	1	and	1	april	1	2021,	1	the-government	1	appeared	1	reluctant	1	to	2	implement	1	the-same-degree	1	of	2	restrictive-measures	1	for	1	fear	1	further-disruptions	1	the-economy.	1
697	in	3	december,	1	the-government	2	focused	1	instead	1	on	1	mass-testing	1	of	1	migrant-workers	1	and	1	travel-restrictions	1	from	1	affected-provinces,	1	while	1	april,	1	allowed	1	the-songkran	1	(thai	1	new	1	year)	1	holidays	1	to	1	go	1	ahead	1	(though	1	without	1	water-splashing-celebrations),	1	despite	1	having	1	cancelled	1	the-holidays	1	2020	1	when	1	the-caseload	1	was	1	lower.	1
698	vaccinations	1	began	1	at	1	the-end	1	of	1	february	1	2021,	1	mostly	1	limited	1	to	1	healthcare-workers	1	and	1	mainly	1	using	1	the-coronavac-vaccine	1	imported	1	from	1	china's-sinovac-biotech.	1
699	the-majority	1	of	1	china's-vaccine-supply	1	is	1	planned	1	to	1	rely	1	heavily	1	on	1	the-oxford–astrazeneca	1	vaccine	1	through	1	a-manufacturing-deal	1	secured	1	by	1	the-siam-bioscience-company,	1	with	1	first-batches	1	expected	1	in	1	june	1	2021.	1
700	the-pandemic	1	has	1	heavily	1	disrupted	1	the-country's-economy,	1	of	1	which	1	tourism	1	is	1	a-significant-sector.	1
701	the-government	1	has	1	borrowed	1	and	2	announced	1	several-assistance-measures,	1	including	1	cash-handouts	1	to	1	those	1	affected	1	a-1.9-trillion-baht-(us$60-billion)-stimulus-package,	1	though	1	few-people	1	have	1	actually	1	received	1	a-1.9-trillion-baht-(us$60-billion)-stimulus-package.	1
702	on	2	12-january,	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who)	1	confirmed	1	that	1	a-novel-coronavirus	1	was	1	the-cause	1	of	4	a-respiratory-illness	1	in	2	a-cluster	1	people	1	wuhan-city,	1	hubei-province,	1	china,	1	who	2	had	1	initially	1	come	1	to	1	the-attention	1	the	1	31-december-2019.unlike-sars	1	2003,	1	the-case-fatality-ratio	1	for	1	covid-19	1	has	2	been	2	much	1	lower,	1	but	1	the-transmission	1	significantly	1	greater,	1	with	1	a-significant-total-death-toll.	1

748	vaccine	1	==	1

750	it	1	requires	1	2-doses	1	of	1	vaccine	1	per	1	person,	1	so	1	the-quantity	1	ordered	1	would	1	only	1	covered	1	13-million-people.	1

752	the-authorities	1	would	1	also	2	imported	1	2-million-doses	1	of	1	vaccine	1	from	1	sinovac,	1	a-chinese-company	1	which	1	thai-conglomerate-charoen-pokphand	1	invested	1	in,	1	during	1	february	1	to	3	april	1	2021.likewise,	1	thai-government	3	stepped	1	up	1	attempt	1	produce	1	homeground	1	vaccines	1	amidst	1	criticism,	1	with	1	"chulacov19"	1	and	1	set	1	put	1	trial	1	on	1	may	1	2021.	1

1002	april	1	to	1	may	1	2020	1	==	1
1003	by	1	april,	1	covid-19	1	had	2	spread	1	to	1	all-17-regions	1	of	3	the-philippines,	1	with	1	the-confirmation	1	a-case	1	in	3	april	1	6	1	a-patient	1	confined	1	at	1	a-hospital	1	surigao-city	1	who	1	been	1	the-caraga-region	1	since	1	march	1	12	1	after	1	traveling	1	from	1	manila.	1
1004	president-duterte	1	on	2	april	3	7	1	accepted	1	the-recommendation	1	of	1	the-inter-agency-task-force	1	emerging-infectious-diseases	1	(iatf-eid)	1	to	1	extend	1	the-ecq	1	in	1	luzon	1	until	1	30.on	1	17	1
1005	,	1	it	1	was	1	reported	1	that	2	the-country	1	had	1	been	1	able	1	to	3	bring	1	down	1	the-viral-disease'-reproduction-number	1	0.65	1	from	2	1.5,	1	which	1	meant	1	the-average-number	1	of	1	people	1	a-person	1	could	1	infect	1	decreased	1	more	1	than	2	one	1	less	1	one.	1
1006	recent-data	1	at	1	the-time	1	suggested	1	that	1	the-country	1	was	2	doing	1	better	1	in	3	"flattening	1	the-curve",	1	but	1	warned	1	of	3	a-"resurgence"	1	and	2	must	1	ramp	1	up	1	mass-testing	1	order	1	to	2	isolate	1	cases	1	avoid	1	further-transmission	1	covid-19.sometime	1	late-april,	1	local-government-units	1	(lgus)	1	were	1	no	1	longer	1	authorized	1	impose	1	quarantine-measures	1	without	1	the-consent	1	the-iatf-eid.	1
1007	prior	1	to	1	that-period,	1	lgus	1	could	1	impose	1	such-measures	1	in	1	coordination	1	with	1	the-department	1	of	1	the-interior-and-local-government.	1
1008	in	1	the-philippines,	1	tens-of-thousands	1	of	2	people	1	who	1	were	2	locked	1	out	1	due	1	to	1	lockdowns	1	faced	1	with	1	the-dual-threat	1	typhoons	1	and	1	viruses,	1	forcing	1	complex-and-dangerous-evacuation.	1
1009	at	1	each-shelter	1	in	2	the-central-part	1	of	3	the-philippines,	1	order	1	to	1	prevent	1	the-spread	1	coronavirus-infection,	1	only-half	1	the-capacity	1	was	2	accepted,	1	and	1	a-mask	1	required	1	when	1	evacuating.	1
1010	by	1	the-time	1	typhoon-vongfong	1	(local-name:-ambo)	1	landed,	1	the-number	2	of	2	confirmed-infections	1	was	2	11,618	1	and	1	deaths	1	(due	1	to	1	infectious-diseases)	1	772	1	in	1	the-philippines.	1
1011	the-remaining-parts	1	of	1	the-country	1	were	1	placed	1	under	1	gcq.	1
1012	june	1	to	1	july	1	2020	1	==	1
1013	quarantine-measures	1	raised	1	throughout	1	the-country	1	started	1	to	2	loosen	1	up	1	on	1	june	1	1,	1	with	1	areas	1	formerly	1	under	1	ecq	1	transitioning	1	a-less-strict-quarantine.	1
1014	this	1	led	1	to	1	a-significant-rise	1	in	1	the-number	1	of	1	confirmed-cases,	1	as	1	more-areas	1	implemented	1	a-gcq.	1
1015	the-official-start	1	of	1	classes	1	in	1	the-elementary-and-secondary-schools	1	which	1	customarily	1	begin	1	on	1	june	1	was	1	postponed.	1
1016	according	1	to	2	the-national-government,	1	the-law	3	expired	2	on	1	june	2	25,	1	due	1	sunset	1	provision	1	although	1	there	1	were	1	interpretations	1	that	1	as	2	early	1	5.	1

1096	testing	1	===	1

1099	all-close-contacts	1	of	2	confirmed-cases	1	that	1	were	1	found	1	through	1	contact-tracing,	1	and	1	(4)	1	all	1	those	1	who	1	tested	1	positive	1	on	1	rapid-antibody-tests.	1
1100	the-government	1	is	2	also	1	opting	1	to	1	test	1	through	1	benchmarks,	1	by	1	testing	1	1–2%	1	of	2	the-philippines'-entire-population	1	and	1	10–12%	1	the-worst-affected-region	1	in	1	the-country,	1	which	1	metro-manila.	1
1101	in	1	late-march	1	2020,	1	some-politicians	1	and	1	their-relatives	1	were	1	reportedly	1	tested	1	for	1	the-disease	2	despite	1	not	1	showing	1	any-symptoms,	1	causing	1	public-backlash	1	amidst	1	a-shortage	1	of	1	testing-kits	1	since	1	was	1	against	1	doh-guidelines	1	to	1	test	1	asymptomatic-individuals.	1
1102	doh-doh	1	responded	1	to	3	the-public-criticism	1	by	1	clarifying	1	that,	1	while	1	there	1	is	1	"no-policy	1	for	2	vip-treatment"	1	with	1	regard	1	testing	1	covid-19	1	and	2	that	1	"all-specimens	1	are	1	being	1	processed	1	on	1	a-first-in,-first-out-basis,"	1	it	1	"extends	1	courtesy"	1	front-line-government-officials,	1	specifically	1	those	1	involved	1	in	1	national-security	1	public-health.	1

1106	the-country	1	has	2	conducted	2	over-3-million-tests	1	as	1	of	2	september	1	2020.on	1	march	1	9,	1	2020,	1	a-total-of-2,000-tests	1	been	1	at	1	a-rate	1	200-to-250-people	1	accommodated	1	by	1	tests	1	per	1	day.	1

1305	prevention-measures	1	and	1	response	1	==	1

1318	testing	1	==	1
1319	by	1	mid-march,	1	the-country	1	could	1	test	1	about-1,000-samples	1	per	1	day,	1	which	1	is	1	less	1	than	1	the-capabilities	1	of	1	other-european-countries.	1
1320	this	1	also	1	explains	1	a-relatively-large-ratio	1	of	3	the-number	2	deaths	1	to	1	confirmed-cases.	1
1321	because	1	of	2	the-limited-availability	1	testing-capacity,	1	certain-groups	1	were	1	prioritised	1	in	1	testing,	1	such	1	as	1	healthcare-workers,	1	elderly,	1	and	1	people	1	with	1	acute-symptoms.	1
1322	a-lack	1	of	2	testing-capacity	1	causes	1	a-distinct-number	1	deaths	1	by	1	covid-19	1	that	1	are	1	not	1	registered	1	as	1	such,	1	although	1	local-doctors	1	can	1	recognise	1	the-symptoms.	1
1323	by	1	the-end	1	of	3	march,	1	the-country	1	was	1	testing	1	about-4,000-people	1	per	1	day,	1	with	1	the-goal	1	expanding	1	the-testing-capacity	1	to	1	about-17,500-daily-tests	1	in	1	a-couple	1	weeks.	1
1324	once	1	such-a-testing-capacity	1	has	1	been	1	reached	1	the-country	2	wants	1	to	2	expand	1	testing	1	capacity	1	29,000-tests	1	a	1	day.	1

1326	several-health-organizations	1	have	1	started	1	testing	1	several-health-organizations,	1	claiming	1	the-procedures	1	of	1	the-ggd-testing-centers	1	take	1	too	1	long.	1
1327	in	1	a-press-conference	1	on	1	6-may,	1	the-government	2	announced	1	that	1	starting	1	from	1	1-june	1	wants	1	to	1	test	1	all-people	1	with	1	covid-19-symptoms.	1
1328	nonetheless,	1	the-test-capacity	1	was	1	increased	1	to	3	30,000	1	per	1	day	1	with	2	the-ggds	1	being	1	able	1	conduct	1	600-to-2400-contact-traces	1	for	2	positively-tested-applicants	1	2-8%	1	of	1	the-tests	1	done	1	assumed	1	result	1	positive	1	the-virus.	1
1329	the-new-system,	1	although	1	initially	1	overwhelmed	1	by	2	the-number	1	of	1	callers	1	on	1	the-first-day,	1	tested	1	50,000-people	1	in	1	the-first-week	1	and	1	had	1	100,000-applicants	1	11-june.	1
1330	by	1	9-june,-most-regions	1	where	1	successful	1	in	1	handling	1	the-increased-demand,	1	with	1	people	1	often	1	being	1	able	1	to	1	schedule	1	a-test	1	the	2	same	1	day	2	or	1	after.	1
1331	in	3	response	1	to	1	regulations	1	announced	1	on	1	12-march,	1	panic-buying	1	of	1	food,	1	toilet-paper	1	and	1	medicines,	1	resulted	1	empty-shelves	1	supermarkets.	1

2034	another-metric	1	in	1	assessing	1	death-rate	1	is	2	the-case-fatality-ratio	1	(cfr),	1	which	1	deaths	1	attributed	1	to	1	disease	1	divided	1	by	1	individuals	1	diagnosed	1	to-date.	1
2035	this-metric	1	can	1	be	1	misleading	1	because	2	of	1	the-delay	1	between	1	symptom-onset	1	and	2	death	1	testing	1	focuses	1	on	2	individuals	1	with	1	symptoms	1	(and	1	particularly	1	those	1	manifesting	1	more-severe-symptoms).	1

2042	there	1	is	1	no-specific,-effective-treatment	1	or	1	cure	1	for	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19),	1	the-disease	1	caused	1	by	1	the-astrazeneca-vaccine.	1

2053	suppression	1	requires	1	more-extreme-measures	1	so	1	as	2	to	3	reverse	1	the-pandemic	1	by	1	reducing	1	the-basic-reproduction-number	1	less	1	than	1	1.part	1	of	1	managing	1	an-infectious-disease-outbreak	1	is	1	trying	1	delay	1	and	1	decrease	1	the-epidemic-peak,	1	known	1	flattening	1	the-epidemic-curve.	1

2524	alphacoronavirus	1	1	1	is	1	a-species	1	of	1	coronavirus	1	that	1	infects	1	cats,	1	dogs	1	and	1	pigs.	1
2525	after	1	subsequent-discovery	1	of	1	canine-coronavirus	1	in	3	dogs	1	and	1	feline	1	coronavirus	1	cats,	1	the-three-viruses	1	were	1	merged	1	into	1	a-single-species	1	2009.	1
2526	the-virus	1	was	1	identified	1	and	1	isolated	1	by	1	a.-w.-mcclurkin	1	in	1	1965.	1
2527	it	1	was	1	again	1	renamed	1	feline	1	coronavirus	1	in	1	1999.	1
2528	nyctalus-velutinus-alphacoronavirus-sc-2013	1	is	1	a-species	1	of	1	coronavirus	1	in	1	the-genus-alphacoronavirus.	1
2529	this-article	1	presents	1	official-statistics	1	gathered	1	during	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	brazil.	1

2532	==	1	https://covid.saude.gov.br/	1	–	1	ministry	1	of	1	health	1	statistics	1	panel,	1	updated	1	daily	1
2533	https://brasil.io/dataset/covid19/caso_full/---brasil.io,	1	an-aggregator	1	of	2	the-data	1	published	1	by	1	the	1	brazilian	1	ministry	1	health	1	severe	1	acute	1	respiratory	1	syndrome	1	coronavirus	1	2	1	(sars‑cov‑2)	1	is	1	the-virus	1	that	1	causes	1	covid-19	1	(coronavirus-disease	1	2019),	1	the-respiratory-illness	1	responsible	1	for	1	the-covid-19-pandemic.	1
2534	also	2	colloquially	1	known	1	simply	1	as	1	the-coronavirus,	1	the	2	brazilian	2	ministry	2	of	2	health	2	severe	2	acute	2	respiratory	2	syndrome	2	coronavirus	3	2	2	(sars‑cov‑2)	2	was	1	previously	1	referred	1	to	1	by	1	provisional	1	name,	1	2019-novel-coronavirus	1	(2019-ncov),	1	and	1	has	1	been	1	called	1	human	1	2019	1
2535	the-world-health-organization	1	declared	1	the-outbreak	1	a-public-health-emergency	1	of	1	international-concern	1	on	2	30-january	1	2020,	1	and	1	a-pandemic	1	11	1	march	1	2020.sars‑cov‑2	1	is	1	a-positive-sense-single-stranded-rna-virus	1	(and	1	hence-baltimore-class-iv)	1
2536	as	1	described	1	by	1	the-us-national-institutes	1	of	1	health,	1	it	1	is	1	the-successor	1	to	1	sars-cov-1,	1	the-virus	1	that	1	caused	1	the-2002–2004-sars-outbreak.	1
2537	research	1	primarily	1	spreads	1	between	1	people	1	through	1	close-contact	1	and	1	via	1	respiratory-droplets	1	produced	1	from	1	coughs	1	or	1	sneezes.	1
2538	in	1	january	1	2020,	1	the-world-health-organisation	1	recommended	1	"2019-novel-coronavirus"	1	(2019-ncov)	1	as	1	the-provisional-name	1	for	1	the-virus.	1
2539	this	1	was	1	in	2	accordance	1	with	1	who's-2015-guidance	1	against	1	using	1	geographical-locations,	1	animal-species,	1	or	1	groups	1	of	1	people	1	disease	1	and	1	virus-names.	1
2540	to	2	avoid	1	confusion	1	with	1	the-disease-sars,	1	the-who	1	sometimes	1	refers	1	sars‑cov‑2	1	as	1	"the-covid-19-virus"	1	in	2	public-health-communications	1	and	1	the-name	1	hcov-19	1	was	1	included	1	some-research-articles.	1
2541	the-general-public	1	often	1	calls	1	both-the-virus	1	and	1	the-disease	1
2542	u.s.-president-donald-trump	2	repeatedly	1	referred	1	to	1	the-disease-sars	1	as	1	the-"chinese-virus"	1	in	1	tweets,	1	interviews,	1	and	1	white-house-press-briefings,	1	which	1	drew	1	some-criticism	1	that	1	was	1	stigmatizing	1	the-disease	1	it	1	causes	1	with	1	racial-or-nationalistic-overtones.	1
2543	other-studies	1	have	1	suggested	1	that	1	the-virus	1	may	1	be	1	airborne	1	as	1	well,	1	with	1	aerosols	1	potentially	1	being	1	able	1	to	1	transmit	1	the-virus.	1
2544	preliminary-research	1	indicates	1	that	1	the-virus	3	may	1	remain	1	viable	1	on	3	plastic	1	(polypropylene)	1	and	1	stainless-steel	1	(aisi	1	304)	1	for	3	up-to-three-days,	1	but	1	does	1	not	1	survive	1	cardboard	1	more-than-one-day	1	or	1	copper	1	more-than-four-hours;	1	is	1	inactivated	1	by	1	soap,	1	which	1	destabilises	1	lipid	1	bilayer.	1
2545	the-degree	1	to	1	which	1	the-virus	1	is	2	infectious	1	during	1	the-incubation-period	1	uncertain,	1	but	1	research	1	has	1	indicated	1	that	1	the-pharynx	1	reaches	1	peak-viral-load	1	approximately	1	four	1	days	1	after	1	infection	1	or	1	the	1	first	1	week	1	of	1	symptoms,	1	and	1	declines	1	after.	1
2546	however,	1	an-epidemiological-model	1	of	4	the-beginning	1	the-outbreak	1	in	1	china	1	suggested	1	that	2	"pre-symptomatic-shedding	1	may	2	be	1	typical	1	among	1	documented-infections"	1	and	1	subclinical-infections	1	have	1	been	1	the-source	1	a-majority	1	infections.	1
2547	similarly,	1	a-study	1	of	3	ninety-four-patients	1	hospitalized	1	in	2	january	1	and	2	february	1	2020	1	estimated	1	patients	1	shed	1	the-greatest-amount	1	virus	1	two	1	to	1	three	1	days	1	before	2	symptoms	1	appear	1	that	1	"a-substantial-proportion	1	transmission	1	probably	1	occurred	1	first-symptoms	1	the-index-case".	1
2548	the-findings	1	had	1	the-implications	1	that	2	herd-immunity	1	may	2	not	3	eliminate	1	the-virus	1	if	1	reinfection	1	is	1	an-uncommon-occurrence	1	and	1	vaccines	1	be	1	able	1	to	1	provide	1	lifelong-protection	1	against	1	the-virus.	1
2549	the-original-source	1	of	1	viral-transmission	1	to	1	humans	1	remains	1	unclear,	1	as	1	does	1	whether	1	the-virus	1	became	1	pathogenic	1	before	1	or	1	after	1	the-spillover-event.	1
2550	because	1	many	1	of	1	the-early-infectees	1	were	1	workers	1	at	1	the-huanan-seafood-market,	1	has	1	been	1	suggested	1	that	1	the-virus	1	might	1	have	1	originated	1	from	1	the-huanan-seafood-market.	1
2551	however,	1	other-research	1	indicates	1	that	1	visitors	1	may	1	have	1	introduced	1	the-virus	1	to	1	the-market,	1	which	1	then	1	facilitated	1	rapid-expansion	1	of	1	the-infections.	1
2552	a	2	march	1	2021	1	who	1	report	1	on	1	joint	1	who-china	1	study	1	stated	1	that	1	human-spillover	1	via	1	an-intermediate-animal-host	1	was	1	the-most-likely-explanation,	1	with	1	direct-spillover	1	from	1	bats	1	next	1	most	1	likely.	1
2553	a-phylogenetic-network-analysis	1	of	1	160-early-coronavirus-genomes	1	sampled	1	from	1	december	1	2019	1	to	2	february	1	2020	1	showed	1	that	1	the-virus	1	type	1	most	2	closely	1	related	1	the-bat-coronavirus	1	was	1	abundant	1	in	1	guangdong,	1	china,	1	and	1	designated-type	1	"a".	1
2554	research	1	into	1	the-natural-reservoir	1	of	2	the-virus	1	that	1	caused	1	the-2002–2004-sars-outbreak	1	has	1	resulted	1	in	1	the-discovery	1	many-sars-like-bat-coronaviruses,	1
2555	although	1	the-role	1	of	3	pangolins	3	as	1	an-intermediate-host	3	was	1	initially	1	posited	1	(a-study	1	published	1	in	1	july	1	2020	1	suggested	1	that	1	are	2	sars‑cov‑2-like-coronaviruses),	1	subsequent-studies	1	have	1	not	1	substantiated	1	sars‑cov‑2-like-coronaviruses)-contribution	1	to	1	the-spillover.	1

2702	later	1	that	2	day,	1	wellington-dufferin-guelph-public-health	1	announced	1	the	1	medical	1	officer	1	of	1	health	1	nicola	1	mercer	1	would	1	issue	1	a-similar-order	1	on	1	april	1	6.	1

2706	data	1	as	1	of	1	april	1	28,	1	2021	1	===	1
2707	lifting	1	of	1	restrictions	1	after	1	the-first-wave	1	===	1
2708	on	2	may	2	14,	1	2020,	1	it	1	was	1	announced	1	that	2	stage	1	1	1	of	2	ontario's-lifting	1	restrictions	1	would	1	take	1	begin	1	20,	1	focusing	1	primarily	1	"workplaces	1	are	1	well-positioned	1	to	2	follow	1	public-health-advice	1	maintain	1	physical-distancing,	1	implement	1	workplace-safety-guidance	1	and	1	limit	1	gatherings".	1
2709	on	1	june	1	8,	1	it	1	was	1	announced	1	that	1	stage	1	2	1	would	1	be	1	implemented	1	across	1	most	1	of	2	the-province,	1	excluding	1	10-southern-ontario-health-regions	1	primarily	1	in	1	the-greater-toronto-and-hamilton-area	1	and	1	along	1	the-canada–united-states-border	1	(such	1	as	1	windsor-essex-county)	1	due	1	to	1	a-large-number	1	active-cases.	1
2710	in	1	addition,	1	ford	1	announced	1	that	2	the-cap	1	on	2	gathering-sizes	1	would	2	be	2	increased	1	to	1	10	1	province-wide	1	regardless	1	of	3	phase,	1	and	1	there	1	a-moratorium	1	evictions	1	through	1	the-end	1	august	1	small-businesses	1	which	1	are	1	eligible	1	for	1	the-canada-emergency-commercial-rent-assistance-program.	1
2711	on	2	june	3	15,	1	the-durham,	1	halton,	1	haldimand-norfolk,	1	hamilton,	1	lambton,	1	niagara,	1	and	2	york-health-regions	1	were	1	allowed	2	to	2	enter	2	stage	2	2	2	2.on	1	22,	1	it	1	was	1	announced	1	that	1	peel	1	toronto	1	would	1	be	1	24.	1
2712	on	2	june	2	24,	1	windsor-essex	2	was	1	announced	1	that	1	most	1	of	1	would	1	be	1	allowed	1	to	1	enter	1	stage	1	2	1	25,	1	excluding	1	kingsville	1	and	1	leamington.	1
2713	on	1	july	1	3,	1	premier-ford	2	stated	1	that	1	did	1	not	1	have	1	a-specific-timetable	1	for	1	stage	1	3;	1	"you	1	see	2	what's	2	happening	2	[in	1	the-united-states]	1	when	1	you	2	move	1	too	1	quickly,	1	south	1	of	1	the-border.	1

2715	on	3	september	2	8,	1	in	1	response	1	to	1	growing-case-numbers,	1	the-provincial-government	1	announced	1	a-moratorium	1	further-lifting	1	of	3	restrictions	1	(such	2	as	2	expansion	1	"social-circles"	1	and	2	gatherings)	1	for	1	at-least-four-weeks,	1	besides	1	those	1	already	1	ongoing	1	schools,	1	reopening	1	selected-casinos	1	26).	1
2716	first-provincewide-shutdown	1	(december	1	26,	1	2020	1	–	1	january	1	25,	1	2021)	1	===	1
2717	on	3	december	2	21,	1	2020,	1	premier-ford	1	announced	1	that	1	in	3	order	1	to	1	"save	1	lives	1	and	1	prevent	1	our-hospitals	1	from	1	being	1	overwhelmed	1	the-coming-weeks",	1	a-"strict"-provincewide-shutdown	1	would	1	begin	1	all-health-regions	2	(regardless	1	of	1	current	1	status	1	the-response-framework)	1	at	1	12:01-a.m.-et	1	26,	1	2020	1	(boxing-day).	1
2718	this-measure	1	was	1	originally	1	to	1	last	1	only-14-days	1	in	1	the-northern-regions	1	of	2	the-province	1	(north	1	sudbury),	1	but	1	on	1	january	1	7,	1	2021	1
2719	this-measure	1	was	1	announced	1	that	1	the-provincewide-shutdown	1	will	1	be	1	extended	1	in	2	the-northern-regions	1	of	1	the-province	1	to	1	the-same-length	1	as	1	southern-ontario.	1
2720	indoor-social-gatherings	1	that	1	involve	1	people	1	from	1	outside	1	of	1	one's-immediate-household	1	are	1	prohibited.	1
2721	essential-retail-businesses	1	are	1	subject	1	to	1	capacity-limits	1	stricter	1	than	1	those	1	used	1	under	1	lockdown	1	(50%	1	for	2	supermarkets	1	and	2	pharmacies,	1	25%	1	liquor-stores	1	allowable-big-box-stores	1	that	1	sell	1	groceries).	1

2724	stay-at-home	1	order	1	(january	1	14	1	–	1	march	1	8,	1	2021)	1	===	1
2725	on	2	january	2	12,	1	2021,	1	citing	1	models	1	forecasting	1	that	1	ontario's-health-care-system	1	will	1	be	1	"overwhelmed"	1	with	1	cases	1	and	3	mortality	1	exceeding	1	those	1	of	2	the-first-wave	1	unless	1	actions	1	are	1	taken,	1	premier-ford	1	declared	1	a-second-provincial-state	1	emergency	1	announced	1	stricter-province-wide-measures,	1	to	1	take	1	effect	1	14	1	at	1	12:01-a.m.-et	1	last	1	through	1	at-least-february	1	11.	1
2726	all-employees	2	were	1	required	1	to	1	work	1	from	1	home	1	if	1	have	1	the-capability	1	of	1	doing	1	so.	1
2727	the-province	1	states	1	that	1	what	1	is	2	considered	1	"essential	1	work"	1	based	1	on	1	"[the]-best-judgement	1	and	1	common-sense	1	of	1	employers".	1
2728	outdoor-gatherings	1	were	1	limited	1	to	2	five-people,	1	and	1	guidance	1	now	1	recommends	1	masks	1	be	1	worn	1	outside	1	(in	1	addition	1	the-existing-indoor-mandate)	1	if	1	social-distancing	1	is	1	not	1	possible.	1
2729	the-closure	1	of	1	schools	1	in	1	hamilton,	1	peel,	1	toronto,	1	windsor-essex,	1	and	4	york	1	was	1	further-extended	1	to	4	february-10.the-ontario-provincial-police	1	(opp),	1	municipal-police-departments,	1	bylaw-officers,	1	provincial-workspace-inspectors,	1	had	1	the-authority	2	issue	1	tickets	1	enforce	1	the	2	stay-at-home	2	order	2	mask	2	mandate,	1	however	1	will	1	not	1	have	1	stop	1	drivers	1	or	1	pedestrians	1	for	1	questioning.	1
2730	premier-ford	1	stated	1	plans	1	for	1	a-compliance-"blitz"	1	of	2	retail-store-inspections	1	beginning	1	the-weekend	1	january	1	15.	1
2731	the-measures	1	faced	1	criticism	1	for	1	disproportionately	1	favouring	1	big-box-retailers,	1	by	1	not	1	restricting	1	the-times	1	of	1	day	1	in	1	which	1	they	2	may	1	offer	1	curbside-pickup-or-delivery-services,	1	or	1	preventing	1	from	1	selling	1	non-essential-goods.	1
2732	on	1	february	1	8,	1	2021,	1	premier-ford	1	announced	1	that	2	the-declaration	1	of	3	emergency	1	would	2	expire,	1	but	1	the	1	stay-at-home	1	order	1	be	1	extended	1	in	1	the-majority	1	health-regions	1	to	1	allow	1	a-gradual-reinstatement	1	the-response-framework.	1
2733	the	1	stay-at-home	1	order	1	was	1	first	1	lifted	1	on	1	february	1	10	1	in	1	eastern-ontario's-hastings-prince-edward-public-health-unit,	1	the-kingston,	1	frontenac	1	and	2	lennox	1	&	1	addington-health-unit,	1	the-renfrew-county-and-district-health-unit.	1

2738	regional-advisory-system	1	===	1	====	2	use	1	during	1	the-second-wave	1	from	1	november	1	7	1	–	1	december	1	26,	1	2020	1
2739	on	1	november	1	3,	1	2020,	1	premier-ford	1	stated	1	that	1	future-modifications	1	of	1	restrictions	1	during	1	the-second-wave	1	will	1	be	1	performed	1	regionally	1	using	1	a-colour-coded-"response-framework".	1
2740	a-colour-coded-"response-framework"	2	went	1	into	1	place	1	on	1	november	2	7.on	1	11,	1	was	2	reported	1	by	3	the-toronto-star	1	that	1	the-ford-government	1	had	1	allegedly	1	ignored	1	recommendations	1	public-health-ontario	1	regarding	1	the-metrics	1	used	1	for	1	the-advisory-system	1	—	1	which	1	were	1	four	1	times	1	narrower	1	than	1	what	1	actually	1	implemented	1	the-ford-government.	1
2741	regions	1	included	1	in	1	each-tier	1	were	1	adjusted	1	to	1	match	1	the-new-thresholds	1	effective	1	november	1	16.	1
2742	premier-ford	3	stated	1	that	3	the-original-criteria	1	was	2	based	1	on	2	earlier-models	1	had	3	anticipated	1	only-950–1,250-new-cases	1	per	1	day	1	by	1	the-time	1	implemented	1	and	1	would	1	not	1	have	1	used	1	them	2	if	1	case-numbers	1	reached	1	the-point	1	november	1	10.	1

2744	due	1	to	2	the-declaration	1	of	1	emergency	1	and	1	a	1	stay-at-home	1	order	1	issued,	1	the-response-framework	1	was	1	officially	1	considered	1	paused	1	from	1	december	1	26,	1	2020	1	february	1	9,	1	2021.	1

2748	additional-modifications	1	were	1	announced	1	on	1	march	2	26;	1	as	1	of	2	29,	1	the-"lockdown"-category	1	began	1	to	1	allow	1	outdoor-fitness-classes	1	up-to-10-people.	1
2749	only	1	at	1	25%	1	capacity/5-people	1	(whichever	1	is	1	fewer)	1	in	1	"lockdown"-regions	1	beginning	1	april	1	12.	1
2750	on	1	april	2	1,	1	2021,	1	amid	1	rising-new-infections,	1	particularly	1	exacerbated	1	by	1	variants	1	of	1	concern	1	and	1	preceding	1	the-easter-weekend,	1	premier-ford	1	announced	1	a-second-province-wide-shutdown	1	beginning	1	3.	1

2753	all-employees	2	must	1	work	1	from	1	home	1	if	1	have	1	the-capability	1	of	1	doing	1	so.	1
2754	following	1	criticism	1	of	4	photos	1	showing	1	displays	1	cloth-masks	1	blocked	1	by	1	local-walmart-stores,	1	representatives	2	the-government	2	clarified	1	that	1	were	1	considered	1	an	1	essential	1	good.	1
2755	the-order	1	does	1	not	2	include	1	paid	2	sick-leave;	1	premier-ford	1	accused	1	those	1	advocating	1	for	1	sick-leave	1	of	1	"playing	1	politics",	1	and	1	directing	1	people	1	to	1	the-canadian-recovery-sickness-benefit	1	(crsb)	1
2756	on	1	april	1	16,	1	premier-ford	1	announced	1	that	2	due	1	to	1	record	1	high-hospitalizations	1	and	2	cases,	1	the	1	stay-at-home	1	order	1	had	1	been	1	extended	1	through	1	at-least-may	1	20,	1	several-additional-restrictions	1	will	1	also	1	be	1	imposed.	1
2757	effective	1	april	1	17,	1	outdoor-gatherings	1	with	1	anyone	1	from	1	outside	1	of	1	the-immediate-household	1	are	2	prohibited,	1	all-outdoor-recreation-amenities	1	must	2	close,-allowable-"big-box"-retail-stores	1	restricted	1	to	1	25%-capacity,	1	and	1	all-non-essential-construction-projects	1	be	1	suspended.	1

2764	vaccines	1	==	1	===	1
2765	on	1	december	1	9,	1	2020,	1	health-canada	1	approved	1	the-pfizer–biontech-covid-19-vaccine.	1
2766	vaccines	1	were	1	distributed	1	amongst	1	the-provinces	1	by	1	the-federal-government.	1
2767	ontario	1	received	2	an-initial-delivery	1	of	3	6,000-doses	1	the-pfizer–biontech-covid-19-vaccine	1	to	1	be	1	before	1	the-end	1	2020.	1
2768	on	1	december	1	14,	1	the-first-vaccination	1	was	1	delivered	1	in	2	ontario	1	toronto,	1	kicking	1	off	1	a-vaccination-rollout.	1
2769	vaccinations	1	began	1	december	1	14,	1	2020	1	in	2	a-pilot-program	1	to	2	vaccinate	1	health-care-workers	1	working	1	long-term-care-homes	1	and	1	later	1	expanded	1	front-line	1	health-care-workers.	1
2770	ontario's-vaccination-task-force	2	later	1	announced	1	plan	1	to	1	inoculate	1	all-long-term-care-home-residents	1	and	2	staff	1	in	1	toronto,	1	peel,	1	york	1	windsor-essex	1	with	1	a-goal-date	1	of	1	january	1	21,	1	2021.	1

2822	testing	1	==	1
2823	as	1	of	2	early-april,	1	accounting-firm-kpmg	1	has	1	been	1	contracted	1	to	1	organize	1	all-the-labs	1	in	1	the-province	1	that	1	are	1	capable	1	microbial-testing.	1
2824	in	1	addition	1	to	1	the-six-public-health-labs,	1	this	1	includes	1	10-hospital-networks	1	and	2	three-private-lab-networks,	1	including	1	dynacare	1	lifelabs.	1
2825	access	1	to	2	testing	1	is	1	set	1	by	1	public-health-ontario	1	who	1	publishes	1	a-guidance-document	1	that	1	defines	1	the-conditions	1	for	1	an-individual	1	be	1	tested.	1
2826	the-set	1	of	1	conditions	1	has	1	been	1	updated	1	repeatedly	1	from	1	january	1	to	2	april	1	2020,	1	at	2	times	1	reducing	1	access	2	and	1	other-times	1	increasing	1	testing.	1
2827	starting	1	in	1	march,	1	the-public-health-units	1	across	1	the-province	1	have	1	opened	1	over-70-assessment-centres,	1	which	1	members	1	of	1	the-public	1	can	1	visit	1	if	1	directed	1	by	1	a-health-professional.	1
2828	this	1	diverts	1	potentially-infected-people	1	from	1	hospitals	1	and	1	doctors'-offices.	1
2829	swabs	1	are	1	also	1	collected	1	at	2	hospitals	1	and	1	by	1	public-health-officials,	1	for	1	example,	1	long-term-care-facilities.	1
2830	since	1	many-cases	1	are	2	not	2	tested,	1	the-number	1	of	2	test-confirmed-cases,	1	which	2	the-infection-numbers	1	reported	1	by	1	the-ontario-government,	1	should	1	be	2	misconstrued	1	as	1	the-actual-number	1	infections,	1	have	1	been	1	estimated	1	to	1	substantially	1	higher.	1
2831	unlike	1	some-countries,	1	the-number	1	of	1	suspected-or-probable-infections	1	is	1	not	1	reported	1	by	1	the-ontario-government.	1
2832	in	2	an-effort	1	to	1	reduce	1	a-burden	1	on	2	provincial-assessment-centres	1	amid	1	a-continued-surge	1	cases,	1	ford	2	announced	2	september	2	23	1	that	1	would	1	expand	1	testing	1	of	1	asymptomatic-people	1	by-appointment	1	into	1	pharmacies	1	across	1	the-province,	1	beginning	1	with	1	60-locations	1	by	1	25.	1
2833	accordingly,	1	the-province	2	announced	1	on	1	september	1	24	1	that	1	would	1	discourage	1	asymptomatic-patients	1	from	1	receiving	1	tests	1	at	1	assessment-centres.	1

2836	of	3	four-to-five-thousand-ontario-households,	1	2%	1	households	1	contained	1	someone	1	who	1	had	1	been	1	tested	1	by	1	april	2	12,	1	increasing	1	to	2	5%	1	on	1	19,	1	whereas	1	the-incidence	1	covid-19-symptoms	1	in	3	a-household	1	decreased	1	from	1	one	2	five	1	seven-households.	1
2837	since	1	january	1	2020,	1	ontario	2	has	1	been	1	increasing	1	capacity	1	to	1	perform	1	testing	1	based	1	on	1	rt-pcr.	1
2838	on	2	march	1	18,	1	2020,	1	the-toronto-star	1	reported	1	that	1	test-results	1	announced	1	by	1	the-provincial-government	2	were	1	several	1	days	1	old,	1	with	1	turnaround-times	1	increasing	1	from	1	24-hours	1	to	2	4-days,	1	leading	1	"making	1	decisions	1	based	1	old-information".	1
2839	the-province	1	was	1	only	1	able	1	to	1	process	1	around-2,000-tests	1	per	1	day	1	by	1	march	1	19,	1	which	1	caused	1	the-backlog.	1
2840	the-backlog	1	increased	1	to	3	over-8,000-unprocessed-samples	1	on	1	march	1	24	1	with	1	patients	1	waiting	1	at-least-four-days	1	for	1	results,	1	partially	1	due	1	fact	1	that	1	private-and-university-laboratories	1	are	1	not	1	allowed	1	process	1	samples.	1

3035	given	1	the-rapidly-increasing-number	1	of	1	cases	1	in	1	metro-manila,	1

3037	salceda	1	specifically	1	proposed	1	the-closure	1	of	2	the-philippine-expressway-network	1	and	2	public-transportation	1	accessing	1	the-region,	1	in	1	addition	1	to	1	the-suspension	1	classes	1	work.	1
3038	president-duterte	1	initially	1	rejected	1	the-proposal	1	claiming	1	it	1	would	1	"hamper	1	the-flow	1	of	1	basic-commodities".	1
3039	secretary-duque,	1	however,	1	raised	1	the-possibility	1	of	2	a-lockdown	1	on	1	certain-cities	1	or	1	towns	1	if	1	cases	1	community-based-transmissions	1	are	1	reported,	1	but	1	not	1	an	1	entire	1	region.	1
3040	on	2	march	2	12,	1	president-duterte	1	announced	1	a-partial-lockdown	1	covering	1	metro-manila,	1	that	1	began	1	15.	1
3041	at	1	one-point	1	during	1	president-rodrigo-duterte's-pronouncement	1	about	1	the-metro-manila-"community-quarantine,"	1	president-duterte	1	said	1	that	1	"they	1	are	1	afraid	1	to	1	call	1	the-metro-manila-"community-quarantine	2	a-lockdown,	1	but	1	is	1	a-lockdown."	1
3042	secretary-eduardo-año	1	of	2	the-department	1	interior	1	and	1	local	1	government	1	(dilg)	1	also	1	said	1	that	1	"enhanced-community-quarantine"	1	should	1	be	1	considered	1	as	1	a-"total-lockdown.	1
3043	"in	1	addition,	1	president-duterte	1	advised	1	local-government-units	1	outside	1	of	3	the-national-capital-region	1	to	1	implement	1	a-community-quarantine	1	in	2	cases	1	where,	1	a-given-level	1	local-government,	1	at-least-two-covid-19-cases	1	are	2	confirmed	1	within	1	a-lower-level	1	local-government	1	jurisdiction;	1	for	1	example,	1	a-province-wide-quarantine	1	should	1	be	1	implemented	1	if	1	there	1	at	1	least	1	two	1
3044	covid-19-cases	1	confirmed	1	within	1	different-cities	1	or	1	municipalities	1	in	1	the-same-province,	1	while	1	a-city/municipality-wide-quarantine	1	should	1	be	1	implemented	1	if	1	there	1	are	1	at	1	least	1	two	1
3045	covid-19-cases	1	confirmed	1	within	1	different-barangays	1	in	1	the-same-city	1	or	1	municipality.	1
3046	the-national-government	1	has	1	given	1	local-government-units	2	under	1	enhanced-community-quarantine	1	in	2	visayas	1	and	2	mindanao	1	relevant-field-offices	1	of	2	the-department	1	health	1	the-power	1	to	1	lift	1	or	1	extend	1	the-lockdown-period	1	jurisdiction.	1
3047	on	1	april	1	6,	1	the-following-localities	1	were	1	under	1	enhanced-community-quarantine:	1	all-regions	1	of	2	luzon,	1	western-visayas,	1	caraga-region,	1	zamboanga-peninsula,	1	samar,	1	biliran,	1	cebu,	1	negros-oriental,	1	camiguin,	1	bukidnon,	1	sultan-kudarat,	1	lanao-del-sur,	1	lanao-del-norte,	1	cotabato,	2	south	1	tawi-tawi,	1	and	1	the-municipality	1	catarman	1	in	1	northern	1	samar.	1
3048	on	2	april	1	24,	1	it	1	was	1	clarified	1	that	1	local-government-units	1	can	1	no	1	longer	1	impose	1	quarantine-measures	1	without	1	the-consent	1	of	1	the-inter-agency-task-force	1	emerging-infectious-diseases	1	(iatf-eid).	1
3049	although	1	exact-measures	2	per	2	level	2	may	1	vary	1	over	1	time	1	due	1	to	1	the-government	2	revising	1	guidelines,	1	the	2	strictest	1	of	1	is	1	the-ecq	1	and	1	most	1	lenient	1	being	1	the-mgcq.	1
3050	ecq	1	was	1	reintroduced	1	in	2	march	1	2021	1	the-greater-manila-area	1	(or	1	ncr	1	plus	1	as	1	designated	1	by	1	the-iatf-eid);	1	new-set	1	of	1	measures	1	were	1	observed.	1
3051	people	2	aged	1	18-years	1	below	1	and	3	above	1	65,	1	with	1	comorbidities,	1	pregnant-women	2	are	1	barred	1	from	1	going	1	out	1	homes	1	except	1	to	2	either	1	obtain	1	essential-goods	1	services	1	or	1	report	1	for	1	work.	1
3052	in	1	addition	1	to	1	front-line-services	1	(health	1	and	1	other-emergency-services);	1	full-operations	1	is	1	allowed	1	for	1	certain-operations	1	including	1	agriculture,-forestry,-aquaculture-and-delivery-and-courier-services	1	of	1	essential-goods.	1
3053	however,	1	with	2	the-ecq-period	1	in	3	march-april	1	2021	1	coinciding	1	the-holy-week	1	and	1	late-release	1	of	4	guidelines	1	the-department	1	transportation,	1	this	1	resulted	1	the-virtual-absence	1	public-transportation	1	some-areas.	1
3054	a-level	1	under	2	gcq,	1	is	1	called	1	a	1	modified	1	general	1	community	1	quarantine	1	(mgcq).sporting	1	activities	1	has	1	been	1	allowed	2	in	1	areas	1	gcq	1	since	1	july	1	2020,	1	although	1	live-spectators	1	are	1	not	1	for	1	sports-events.	1
3055	prior	1	to	1	the-imposition	1	of	1	the-enhanced-community-quarantine	1	in	2	luzon,	1	a-more-lenient-measure,	1	which	1	includes	1	a	2	stay-at-home	1	order	1	and	2	a-curfew,	1	was	2	imposed	1	metro-manila	1	officially	1	called	1	"community	1	quarantine".	1
3056	in	1	may	1	2020,	1	additional-terms	1	were	1	coined	1	by	1	the-government	2	to	2	categorize	1	the-community-quarantine	1	according	1	risk	1	assessment	1	and	2	those-new-terms	1	are	1	"modified-enhanced-community-quarantine,"-"modified-general-community-quarantine"	1	"new	1	normal.	1	"	1
3057	a-"total-lockdown"-measure,	1	distinct	1	from	2	an-ecq,	1	has	1	been	1	considered,	1	which	1	would	1	prohibit	1	people	2	leaving	1	places	1	of	2	residence	1	and	1	mandate	1	the-closure	1	all-public-establishments.	1
3058	according	1	to	1	presidential-spokesperson-harry-roque,	1	a-"total-lockdown"-measure,	1	distinct	1	from	2	an-ecq,	1	has	1	been	1	considered,	1	which	1	would	1	prohibit	1	people	1	leaving	1	their-places	1	of	2	residence	1	and	1	mandate	1	the-closure	1	all-public-establishments	1	is	1	considered	1	as	1	an-option.	1
3059	a-classification	1	of	1	measures	1	called	1	"new	1	normal",	1	a-level	1	under	1	mgcq,	1	was	1	introduced	1	sometime	1	in	1	june	1	2020,	1	but	1	has	1	not	1	yet	1	been	1	used.	1
3060	an-indefinite-enhanced-community-quarantine,	1	was	1	imposed	3	in	2	caraga,	2	alternatively	1	known	1	as	1	one	1	shield	1	started	1	on	2	april	2	7,	1	and	3	the-davao-region	1	which	1	took	1	effect	1	4.provinces	1	that	1	an-enhanced-community-quarantine	1	include	1	iloilo	2	(march	7	21),	2	antique	1	22),	1	negros-occidental	1	30),	3	cebu	2	negros-oriental	1	(april	1	3).the	1	independent	1	cities	1	of	1	bacolod	1	city	2	28)	1	also	1	ecq-measures.	1
3061	on	1	may	2	12,	1	2020,	1	it	1	was	1	originally	1	announced	1	that	1	community-quarantine-measures	1	will	1	be	1	lifted	1	in	1	41-provinces	2	and	2	11-cities	2	across	2	the-country	2	due	1	to	2	being	1	low-risk	1	for	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19),	1	but	1	were	1	eventually	1	upgraded	1	modified-general-community-quarantine	1	(mgcq)	1	after	1	receiving	1	petitions	1	from	1	lgus	1	starting	1	16.on	1
3062	,	1	the-iatf-eid	1	approved	1	the-appeal	1	of	3	mayor-lani-mercado-revilla	1	placing	1	the-city	1	bacoor	1	in	1	the-province	1	cavite	1	under	1	modified-enhanced-community-quarantine.	1

3116	mecq	1	took	1	effect	1	immediately	1	and	1	will	1	stay	1	in	1	place	1	until	1	further-notice.	1
3117	there	1	was	2	a-plan	1	to	2	place	1	the-entire-country	1	under	2	mgcq	1	by	2	march	1	2021,	1	which	1	first	1	proposed	1	the-national-economic-and-development-authority	1	(neda)	1	allow	1	the-reopening	1	of	1	industries	1	closed	1	stricter-quarantine-measures.	1

3528	the-covid-19-immunization-program-management-organizational-structure	1	was	2	formed	1	on	2	october	1	26,	1	2020	1	to	1	facilitate	1	the-distribution	1	of	1	covid-19-vaccines	1	in	1	the-philippines,	1	however	1	this	1	replaced	1	by	2	a-vaccine-cluster	1	within	1	the-inter-agency-task-force	1	emerging-infectious-diseases	1	(iatf-eid)	1	november	1	6,	1	2020.	1

3530	the-covid-19-immunization-program-management-organizational-structure	2	was	1	formed	1	on	1	october	1	26	1	with	1	the-intention	1	of	2	overseeing	1	the-distribution	1	covid-19-vaccines	1	once	1	these	1	became	1	available.	1

5692	2020	1	in	3	indonesia	3	2021	1	statistics	1	of	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1
5693	covid-19-vaccination	1	in	1	indonesia	1
5694	the-virus	1	invades	1	and	1	replicates	1	in	1	the-villi	1	of	1	the-small-intestine.	1

5699	new-confirmed-cases	1	per	1	day	1	in	1	thailand	1	===	2
5700	new-confirmed-deaths	1	per	1	day	1	in	1	thailand	1	===	1	==	1
5701	(sars-cov-2),	1	the-virus	1	which	1	causes	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1
5702	the-first-human-cases	1	of	3	covid-19	1	were	1	identified	1	in	3	wuhan,	1	the-capital	1	the-province	1	hubei	1	china	1	december	1	2019.	1
5703	world-maps	1	showing	1	total-cases	1	and	1	cases	1	per	1	100,000	1	by	1	country.	1
5704	deaths	1	===	1
5705	total-cases	1	and	1	deaths	1	==	1
5706	the-2020-and-2021-tables	1	below	1	contain	1	the-cumulative-number	1	of	2	monthly-deaths	1	from	1	the-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	reported	1	by	1	each-country	1	and	2	territory	1	to	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who)	1	published	1	in	1	the	1	who's	1	daily	1	situation	1	reports.	1
5707	cases	1	and	1	deaths	1	by	1	region	1	===	1	=	1
5708	the-government	2	of	4	egypt	2	denied	1	january-2021-allegations	1	that	1	the-shortage	1	oxygen	1	had	1	killed	1	several-covid-19-patients	1	at	1	one	1	hospitals.	1
5709	as	1	of	2	march	1	2021,	1	7-sovereign-states	1	(5	1	in	2	oceania	1	and	1	2	1	asia)	1	have	1	not	1	confirmed	1	any-cases	1	covid-19.	1
5710	us-data-corona-map-coronavirus-timeline-map-coronavirus	1	covid-19	1
5711	see	1	how	1	covid-19	2	has	1	spread	1	the	1	pandemic	1	in	1	italy	1	is	1	part	1	of	2	the-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
5712	the-virus	1	was	1	first	1	confirmed	1	to	2	have	1	spread	1	italy	1	on	1	31-january	1	2020,	1	when	1	two-chinese-tourists	1	in	1	rome	1	tested	1	positive	1	for	1	the-virus.	1
5713	one	1	week	1	later	1	an-italian-man	1	repatriated	1	back	1	to	1	italy	1	from	1	the-city	1	of	1	wuhan,	1	china,	1	was	1	hospitalised	1	and	1	confirmed	1	as	1	the-third-case	1	in	1	italy.	1
5714	clusters	1	of	1	cases	1	were	1	later	1	detected	1	in	1	lombardy	1	and	1	veneto	1	on	2	21-february,	1	with	1	the-first-deaths	1	22-february.	1
5715	by	1	the-beginning	1	of	2	march,	1	the-virus	1	had	1	spread	1	to	1	all-regions	1	italy.	1
5716	on	1	31-january,	1	the-italian-government	1	suspended	1	all-flights	1	to	1	and	2	from	1	china	1	declared	1	a-state	1	of	1	emergency.	1
5717	in	2	october,	1	italy	1	was	1	hit	1	by	1	the-second-wave	1	of	2	the-pandemic,	1	which	1	brought	1	the-government	1	to	1	introduce	1	further-restrictions	1	on	1	movement	1	and	1	social-life,	1	which,	1	as	1	march	1	2021,	1	are	1	still	1	effect.	1
5718	as	1	of	2	24-april	1	2021,	1	italy	1	has	1	461,448-active-cases,	1	one	1	the	1	highest	1	in	1	the-world.	1
5719	by	1	24-april,	1	italy	1	had	1	tested	1	about-25,115,000-people.	1

5958	the-rules	1	were	2	first	1	imposed	1	in	1	march,	1	and	1	to	1	be	1	extended	1	until	1	january	1	21,	1	2021	1	"for	1	travellers	1	entering	1	canada	1	from	1	a-country	1	other	1	than	1	the-united-states.	1

6424	covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	pakistan	1
6425	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	vietnam	1	is	1	part	1	of	2	the-ongoing-worldwide-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
6426	as	1	of	2	29-april	1	2021,	1	the-ministry	1	health	1	has	1	officially	1	reported	1	2,910-confirmed-cases,	1	2,516-recoveries,	1	and	1	35-deaths.	1
6427	hải-dương-province,	1	as	1	of	1	april	1	2021	1	is	1	the-most-affected-locale	1	with	1	762-confirmed-cases	1	and	1	no-deaths.	1
6428	on	1	31-december	1	2019,	1	china	1	announced	1	the-discovery	1	of	2	a-cluster	1	pneumonia-cases	1	in	1	wuhan.	1
6429	the-discovery	2	of	4	a-cluster	2	pneumonia-cases	2	in	3	wuhan	1	was	1	first	1	confirmed	1	to	2	have	1	spread	1	vietnam	1	on	1	23-january	1	2020,	1	when	1	two-chinese-people	1	ho-chi-minh-city	1	tested	1	positive	1	for	1	wuhan.	1
6430	early-cases	1	were	1	primarily	1	imported	1	until	1	local-transmission	1	began	1	to	1	develop	1	in	1	february	1	and	1	march.	1
6431	clusters	1	of	1	cases	1	were	1	later	1	detected	1	in	1	vĩnh-phúc,	1	hanoi,	1	ho-chi-minh-city,	1
6432	đà-nẵng	1	and	1	hải-dương-province,	1	with	1	the-first-death	1	on	1	31-july-2020.vietnam	1	has	1	suspended	1	the-entry	1	of	2	all-foreigners	1	from	1	22-march	1	2020	1	until	1	further-notice	1	to	1	limit	1	the-spread	1	covid-19.	1
6433	in	1	january	1	2021,	1	the-government	1	announced	1	a-stricter-quarantine-policy	1	to	1	"protect	1	the-country"	1	during	1	2021-lunar-new-year.	1
6434	everyone	1	entering	1	vietnam	1	must	1	be	2	isolated	1	for	1	at	2	least	1	14-day	1	the-government's-quarantine-facilities,	1	only-special-diplomats	1	identified	1	as	1	such	1	by	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	foreign-affairs	1	would	1	exempt.	1
6435	vietnam	1	has	1	been	1	cited	1	as	2	having	1	one	1	of	2	the-best-organized-epidemic-control-programs	1	in	1	the-world,	1	along	1	the-lines	1	other-highlighted-states	1	such	1	south-korea,	1	singapore	1	and	1	taiwan.	1
6436	despite	1	inferior-economic-and-technological-capacity,	1	the-country's-response	1	to	2	the-outbreak	2	has	1	received	1	widespread-international-acclaim	1	for	1	immediacy,	1	effectiveness	1	and	4	transparency,	1	in	4	contrast	1	censorship	1	china	1	the-poor-preparation	1	lackluster-response	1	the-united-states	1	european-countries.	1
6437	although	1	the-pandemic	1	has	1	heavily	1	disrupted	1	the-country's-economy,	1	vietnam's-gdp-growth-rate	1	still	1	remained	1	one	1	of	4	the	1	highest	1	in	3	asia-pacific-region,	1	at	1	2.91%	1	2020	1	and	1	projected-growth	1	6.6%	1	2021.vaccinations	1	commenced	1	on	1	8-march	1	2021	1	with	1	a-total	1	425,638-people	1	receiving	1	at-least-one-dose	1	covid-19-vaccine	1	by	1	28-april	1	2021.	1
6438	so	1	far,	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	health	1	has	1	approved	1	covid-19-vaccine	1	from	1	astrazeneca	1	and	1	sputnik-v	1	for	1	use	1	in	1	emergencies.	1
6439	it	1	expected	1	that	1	a-total	1	of	2	150-million-doses	1	would	1	be	1	available	1	by	1	the-end	1	2021.	1
6440	the-evidence	1	shows	1	that	1	the-virus	1	might	1	have	1	originated	1	from	1	an-animal-coronavirus,	1	but	1	somehow	1	entered	1	the-human-population.	1
6441	although	1	it	1	is	1	still	1	unknown	1	exactly	1	where	1	its-outbreak	1	first	1	started,	1	many-early-cases	1	of	1	covid-19	1	have	2	been	1	attributed	1	to	1	people	1	who	1	visited	1	the-huanan-seafood-wholesale-market,	1	located	1	in	1	wuhan,	1	hubei,	1	china.	1
6442	the-earliest-known-person	2	with	3	symptoms	2	was	1	later	1	discovered	1	to	1	have	2	fallen	1	ill	1	on	1	1-december	1	2019,	1	and	1	did	1	not	1	visible-connections	1	the-later-wet-market-cluster.	1
6443	china	1	publicly	1	reported	1	the-cluster	1	on	1	31-december	1	2019.	1
6444	the-world-health-organization	2	(who)	1	issued	1	(-first-report	1	on	2	the-outbreak	1	5-january	1	2020.	1
6445	on	1	12-january	1	2020,	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who)	1	confirmed	1	that	1	a-novel-coronavirus	1	was	2	the-cause	1	of	2	a-respiratory-illness	1	in	2	a-cluster	1	people	1	wuhan,	1	hubei-province,	1	china,	1	which	1	reported	1	earlier.	1
6446	on	1	january	1	20,	1	the-who	1	and	1	china	1	both	1	confirmed	1	that	1	human-to-human-transmission	1	had	1	occurred.	1
6447	on	1	30-january,	1	the-who	1	declared	1	the-outbreak	1	a-public-health-emergency	1	of	2	international-concern	1	(pheic),	1	after	1	mounting-evidence	1	that	1	the-novel-coronavirus	1	had	1	spread	1	to	1	18-countries	1	and	1	completion	1	investigation	1	in	1	wuhan.	1
6448	vietnam	1	has	1	a-history	1	of	1	successfully	1	managing	1	pandemics:	1	it	1	was	2	the-second-country	1	after	2	china	1	to	1	face	1	sars	2	and,	1	63-cases	1	and	1	five-deaths,	1	the-first-country	1	declared	1	sars-free	1	by	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who).	1
6449	in	2	the-wake	1	of	1	sars,	1	vietnam	2	increased	1	investments	1	public	1	health	1	infrastructure,	1	developing	1	a-national-public-health-emergency-operations-center	1	and	2	a-national-public-health-surveillance-system,	1	maintaining	1	robust-systems	1	to	1	collect	1	aggregate	1	public-data.	1
6450	since	1	2016,	1	hospitals	1	are	1	required	1	to	2	report	1	notifiable-diseases	1	within	1	24-hours	1	a-central-database,	1	ensuring	1	that	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	health	1	can	1	track	1	epidemiological-developments	1	across	1	the-second-country	1	after	1	china.	1
6451	in	3	collaboration	1	with	1	the-us-centers	1	for	1	disease-control	1	and	2	prevention	1	(cdc),	1	vietnam	1	implemented	1	an-innovative-“event-based”-surveillance-program	1	2018,	1	empowering	1	members	1	of	2	the-public,	1	including	1	teachers,	1	pharmacists,	1	religious-leaders,	1	even-traditional-medicine-healers,	1	to	2	report	1	public-health-events,	1	order	1	identify	1	clusters	1	people	1	who	1	have	1	similar-symptoms	1	that	1	might	1	suggest	1	an-outbreak	1	is	1	emerging.	1
6452	with	2	a-population	1	of	2	nearly-100-million-people,	1	receiving	1	the-millions	1	chinese-visitors	1	each	1	year,	1	having	1	long-land-border	1	and	1	strong-economic-ties	1	china,	1	which	1	is	1	hanoi's-largest-trading-partner,	1	china	1	was	1	initially	1	perceived	1	to	1	be	1	hit	1	hard	1	by	1	the-pandemic.	1
6453	when	1	vietnam	1	recorded	1	china	1	two-first-confirmed-cases	1	on	1	23-january	1	2020,	1	it	1	was	1	among	1	the-first-countries	1	affected	1	by	1	covid-19.	1
6454	however,	1	one	2	year	1	later	1	the-situation	1	was	2	very	1	different:	1	instead	1	of	2	having	1	a-large-scale-outbreak,	1	vietnam	1	the-countries	1	with	1	the-lowest-cases	1	and	1	mortality	1	per	1	million-inhabitants.	1
6455	the-first-two-confirmed-cases	1	in	1	vietnam	1	were	1	admitted	1	to	1	cho-ray-hospital,	1	ho-chi-minh-city	1	on	1	22-january	1	2020.	1
6456	the-first-two-confirmed-cases	2	in	4	vietnam	2	were	1	a-chinese-man,	1	born	1	1954,	1	and	1	his-son,	1	the	1	former	1	had	1	flown	1	to	3	hanoi	1	from	2	wuhan	1	visit	1	his-son	1	who	1	was	1	believed	1	have	1	contracted	1	the-virus	1	his-father	1	when	1	met	1	nha-trang	1	on	1	17-january.	1
6457	after	1	a-few-workers	1	returned	1	from	1	a-business-trip	1	in	2	wuhan	1	and	1	infected	1	other-people	1	close-contact	1	with	1	other-people.	1
6458	the-vietnamese-government	1	immediately	1	locked	1	down	1	bình-xuyên-district	1	until	1	4-march	1	2020	1	to	1	prevent	1	the-disease	1	from	1	spreading	1	all	1	over	1	the-vietnamese-government.	1
6459	having	1	known-cases	1	early	1	is	1	one	1	of	1	the-main-reasons	1	why	1	vietnam	1	was	1	successful	1	in	1	fighting	1	the-virus.	1
6460	for	1	the-first-16-cases	1	of	2	the-disease,	1	the-medical-staff	1	had	1	to	1	treat	1	different-types	1	patients,	1	including	1	infants,	1	the	1	elderly	1	and	1	people	1	with	1	underlying-conditions.	1
6461	when	1	the-pandemic	1	spreads	1	across	1	the-globe,	1	the-coronavirus-cases	1	in	2	the-country	1	also	1	surged,	1	and	1	on	1	the-evening	1	of	2	6-march,	1	hanoi-department	1	health	1	confirmed	1	the-first-case	1	the-capital,	1	a	1	26-year-old	1	woman	1	who	1	had	1	travelled	1	to	1	europe.	1
6462	this	1	is	1	the-first-case	1	in	1	the-capital.	1
6463	on	1	the-afternoon	1	of	3	20-march,	1	the-ministry	1	health	1	announced	1	2-new-covid-19-patients,	1	the	1	86th	1	and	1	87th,	1	who	1	were	1	two-female-nurses	1	at	1	bạch-mai-hospital	1	with	2	no-history	1	contact	1	any-covid-19-patients.	1
6464	in	3	march	1	and	3	april	1	2020,	1	the-number	1	of	3	cases	1	increased	1	rapidly	1	due	1	to	1	the-large-number	1	people	1	coming	1	from	1	european-countries	1	the-appearance	1	clusters	1	such	1	as	1	bạch-mai-hospital,	1	ha-loi-commune	1	hanoi	1	buddha-bar	1	ho-chi-minh-city.	1
6465	after	1	21-march	1	2020,	1	vietnam	1	suspended	1	entry	2	for	3	all-foreigners	1	from	1	midnight	1	of	2	22-march,	1	and	1	introduced	1	concentrated-isolation	1	14-days	1	in	1	all-cases	1	vietnamese	1	citizens.	1
6466	from	1	1-april,	1	vietnam	1	implemented	1	nationwide-isolation	1	for	1	15-days.	1
6467	the-drastic-epidemic-control-measures	1	had	1	positive-results	1	and	1	vietnam	1	did	1	not	1	confirm	1	any-cases	1	of	2	local-transmission	1	from	1	mid-april	1	to	1	the-end	1	july.	1
6468	vietnam	1	began	1	loosening	1	restrictions	1	in	1	may,	1	including	1	resuming	1	domestic-travel	1	across	1	vietnam.	1
6469	the-country	1	entered	1	second-wave	1	of	3	infection	2	when	1	the-ministry	1	health	1	announced	1	the-416th-case	1	in	2	da-nang,	1	which	1	was	1	the-first-case	1	with	1	an-unknown-source	1	99-days.	1
6470	on	1	28-july,	1	the-da-nang-authorities	1	immediately	1	locked	1	down	1	the-city	1	for	1	15-days.	1
6471	hundreds	1	of	1	cases	1	across	1
6472	the-country	1	with	1	epidemiological-factors	1	related	1	to	1	da-nang	1	were	1	furthermore	1	detected,	1	and	1	the-first-death	1	was	1	also	1	recorded	1	on	1	31-july.	1
6473	after	1	two-months,	1	by	1	using	1	the-same-strategies	1	that	1	have	1	been	1	used	1	in	1	the-first-outbreak,	1	vietnam	1	has	2	successfully	1	contained	1	the-disease	1	for	1	the-second-time	1	and	1	resumed	1	almost-all-economic-activities,	1	including	1	international-commercial-flights.	1
6474	sporadic-community-infections	1	continue	1	during	1	november	1	and	2	december,	1	causing	1	public-scare	1	heightened-measures.	1
6475	the-third-wave	1	of	1	infection	1	began	1	on	1	28-january	1	2021,	1	when	1	vietnam	1	recorded	1	an-additional-84-community-transmission-cases	1	within	1	a-single-day	1	in	1	hải-dương-and-quảng-ninh-provinces.	1
6476	initially,	1	the-government	1	only	1	quarantine	1	the-areas	1	directly	1	related	1	to	2	the-infected-people	1	limit	1	the-economic-impact.	1
6477	but	1	after	1	half-a-month	1	the-number	1	of	3	cases	1	still	1	showed	1	no-signs	1	stopping,	1	so	1	on	1	15-february,	1	entire-province	1	hải-dương	1	was	1	locked	1	down	1	for	1	15-days	1	while	1	hanoi	1	and	1	ho-chi-minh-city	1	stopped	1	all-entertainment-activities.	1
6478	this	1	is	1	the-most-serious-outbreak	1	happened	1	since	1	the-beginning	1	of	2	the-pandemic	1	due	1	to	2	slow	1	tracing-process,	1	mismanagement	1	in	1	quarantine-facilities	1	and	1	people	1	starting	1	ignore	1	lockdown-rules	1	after	1	long-period	1	restrictions.	1
6479	on	1	7-march	1	2021,	1	the-outbreak	1	in	1	northern-provinces	1	appears	1	to	2	have	1	been	1	largely	1	brought	1	under	1	control	1	when	1	number	1	of	1	new-cases	1	fell	1	single-digits.	1
6480	along	1	with	1	that,	1	vietnam	2	started	1	mass	1	covid-19	1	vaccination	1	campaign	1	on	1	the-next-day.	1
6481	prof.,	1	dr.-le-quynh-mai,	1	deputy-director	1	of	2	national-institute	1	hygiene	1	and	1	epidemiology,	1	said	1	the-virus	1	causing	1	covid-19	1	has	1	evolved	1	into	1	many-branches.	1
6482	vietnam	1	recorded	1	and	2	isolated	1	two-different-virus-branches,	1	one	1	from	4	patients	2	returning	2	wuhan	1	in	2	february	1	the	1	other	1	europe	1	march.	1
6483	in	2	may	1	2020,	1	vietnam	1	declared	1	that	1	their-covid-19-vaccine	1	was	1	developed	1	after	1	scientists	1	successfully	1	generated	1	the-novel-coronavirus-antigen	1	the-lab.	1
6484	according	1	to	2	the-national-institute	1	of	1	hygiene	1	and	1	epidemiology,	1	it	1	will	1	take	1	at-least-12–18-months	1	develop	1	vaccine	1	that	1	can	1	work	1	safely	1	on	1	human.	1
6485	in	2	october	1	2020,	1	the-vabiotech-covid-19-vaccine	1	has	1	been	1	tested	1	on	1	12-rhesus-macaques	1	(macaca-mulatta)	1	an-island	1	off	1	the-northern-quang-ninh-province.	1
6486	the-result	1	of	1	these-trials	1	will	1	be	1	presented	1	before	1	the-health-ministry's-ethical-board	1	within	1	the-following-four-months	1	if	1	experiments	1	show	1	the-vaccine	1	does	1	produce	1	effective-immunogenicity	1	and	1	provide	1	effective-protection	1	against	1	covid-19.	1
6487	it	1	will	1	be	1	a-foundation	1	for	2	the-next-stage	1	testing	1	the-vaccine	1	on	1	humans.	1
6488	vietnam	1	currently	2	has	1	four-covid-19-vaccines	1	produced	1	by	1	nanogen,	1	vabiotech,	1	polyvac	1	and	2	the-institute	1	of	1	vaccines	1	medical-biologicals	1	(ivac)	1	under	1	research.	1
6489	ivac	3	and	5	vabiotech	3	have	1	completed	1	laboratory-scale	1	production	1	process	1	are	1	evaluating	1	the-safety	1	immunity	1	of	1	vaccines	1	on	1	animals.	1
6490	if	1	the-government	2	goes	2	ahead	2	with	2	the-emergency-decision,	1	the-emergency-decision	1	may	1	be	1	rolled	1	out	1	in	1	may,	1	a-nanogen-official	1	told	1	nikkei-asia.	1
6491	vũ-đức-đam	1	received	1	the-second-dose	1	of	1	the-nanocovax-covid-19-vaccine.	1
6492	on	1	21-january,	1	the-second-vietnam	1	produced	1	covid-19-vaccine	1	(covivac)	1	by	1	institute	1	of	2	vaccine	1	and	1	medical-biologicals	1	(ivac)	1	has	1	entered	1	a-human-clinical-trial,	1	nearly	1	two	1	months	1	ahead	1	schedule.	1
6493	on	1	16-march,	1	vietnam	1	received	1	1,000-doses	1	of	1	sputnik-v	1	from	1	russian-security-council-secretary-nikolai-patrushev.	1
6494	the-first-batch	1	of	1	vaccines	1	sourced	1	via	1	covax-mechanism,	1	containing	1	811,200-doses,	1	arrived	1	in	1	hanoi's-noi-bai-international-airport	1	on	1	1-april	1	2021.	1
6495	it	1	expected	1	that	1	a-total	1	of	2	150-million-doses	1	would	1	be	1	available	1	by	1	the-end	1	2021.vietnam's-covid-19-vaccination-programme	1	began	1	on	1	8-march	1	2021,	1	administering	1	the-astrazeneca-vaccine	1	to	1	medical-workers	1	in	1	hanoi,	1	ho-chi-minh-city-and-hải-dương-province.	1
6496	the-country	2	is	1	expected	1	to	1	reach	1	vaccination	1	coverage	1	target	1	of	1	80%	1	in	1	june	1	2022.	1
6497	from	2	the-experiences	1	gained	1	the-sars-outbreak	1	in	2	2003,	1	vietnam	1	has	1	been	1	proactive	1	treating	1	covid-19-patients.	1
6498	to	2	leave	1	the-hospital,	1	patients	1	need	1	have	1	two-consecutive-negative-samples	1	of	1	covid-19-(both-pharyngeal-and-pharyngeal-fluid),	1	taken	1	at-least-24-hours/test.	1
6499	after	1	leaving	1	the-hospital,	1	the-patient	1	must	1	continue	1	to	1	isolate	1	at	1	home	1	for	1	another-14-days.	1
6500	during	1	the-second-wave	1	in	2	da-nang,	1	the-treatment-regimen	1	used	1	vietnam	1	underwent	1	many-improvements.	1
6501	compared	1	to	2	the-beginning	1	of	1	2020,	1	patients	2	mainly	2	treated	2	by	2	many-improvements-symptoms	1	and	2	medical-staffs	2	will	1	try	1	improve	1	their	1	symptoms	1	condition,	1	while	1	in	1	the-new-regimen,	1	antiviral-drugs	1	proved	1	more	1	effective	1	for	1	covid-19-patients.	1
6502	specifically,	1	lopinavir,	1	ritonavir	1	and	1	interferon	1	have	1	been	1	used	1	effectively	1	by	1	vietnam,	1	with	1	patients	1	becoming	1	virus	1	free	1	after	1	7-days	1	of	1	use.	1
6503	doctors	1	have	1	been	1	studying	1	plasma-therapy	1	for	2	covid-19-treatment	1	since	1	april	1	2020	1	and	1	the-hanoi-national-hospital	1	tropical-diseases	1	still	1	continues	1	to	1	select	1	plasma-donors.	1
6504	however,	1	no-patient	1	in	1	the-country	1	has	1	been	1	treated	1	with	1	this-method.	1
6505	plasma	1	can	1	be	1	very	1	effective	1	in	1	treating	1	many-diseases,	1	but	1	with	1	covid-19	1	the-benefits	1	are	1	still	1	limited.	1
6506	in	1	october	1	2020,	1	the	1	scientists	1	at	1	the-medical-genetics-institute,	1	the-ho-chi-minh-city-center	1	for	1	disease-control	1	(hcdc)	1	and	1	ho-chi-minh	1
6507	city-medicine-and-pharmacy-university	1	are	1	planning	1	to	3	sequence	1	the-genomes	1	of	1	novel-coronavirus	2	understand	1	how	1	affects	1	people	1	with	1	different-genetic-makeups	1	and	1	possibly	1	identify	1	genes	1	sensitive	1	the-virus	1	for	1	better-treatment-method.	1
6508	the-newly-acquired-covid-19-strain	1	that	1	entered	1	vietnam	1	in	2	the-second-wave	1	has	1	a-mutation	1	which	1	increases	1	the-infection-rates,	1	leading	1	to	1	a-high-number	1	of	1	cases	1	a-second-wave.	1
6509	nguyen-thanh-long,	1	minister	1	of	2	health,	1	said	1	that	2	the-newly-acquired-covid-19-strain	1	entered	1	vietnam	1	in	1	the-second-wave	1	was	1	imported	1	from	1	outside	1	vietnam.	1
6510	the-newly-acquired-covid-19-strain	1	that	1	entered	1	vietnam	1	in	2	the-second-wave	1	may	1	already	1	have	1	started	1	early-july.	1
6511	the-basic-reproduction-number	1	(r0)	1	in	2	the-second-wave	1	was	2	5	1	to	2	6,	1	while	1	april	1	this	1	only	1	from	1	1.8	1	2.2.	1
6512	the-rate	1	of	2	positive-results	1	people	1	who	1	had	1	indirect-contact	1	with	1	covid-19-patients	1	are	1	also	1	higher	1	than	1	in	1	the-previous-wave.	1
6513	scientists	1	point	1	out	1	that	1	this-strain	1	of	2	the-virus	1	is	1	aggressive	1	and	1	capable	1	causing	1	a-transition	1	to	1	a-serious-condition	1	more	1	quickly.	1
6514	the-ministry	1	of	3	health	1	sent	1	the-best-experts	1	to	3	da-nang	1	help	1	the-city	1	contain	1	the-spread	1	the-infection	1	and	1	quickly	1	identify	1	the-source	1	the-infection.	1
6515	the-ministry	1	of	1	health	1	also	1	submitted	1	the-new-strain's-data	1	to	1	a-world-gene-bank	1	for	1	comparison.	1
6516	on	1	4-august,	1	the-ministry	1	of	2	health	1	confirmed	1	that	1	the-strain	1	coronavirus	1	in	2	vietnam	1	the-second-wave	1	is	1	d614g,	1	also-the-dominant-mutation	1	wreaking	1	havoc	1	across	1	the-globe.	1
6517	a-study	1	published	1	by	4	the-los-alamos-national-laboratory	1	in	2	new-mexico	1	asserts	1	that	1	patients	3	infected	3	that-mutation	3	actually	1	have	1	more-virus	1	bodies,	1	making	1	more	1	likely	1	to	2	spread	1	it	1	others.	1
6518	as	1	of	1	february	1	2021,	1	vietnam	1	recorded	1	at-least-five-coronavirus-strains:	1	the-original-wuhan-variant,	1	the-uk-variant	1	(lineage-b.1.1.7),	1	indian-variant,	1	south-african-variant,	1	a.23.1	1	from	1	rwanda,	1	cal.20c-variant	1	and	1	d614g-coronavirus-mutation.	1
6519	many-covid-19-cases	2	in	2	vietnam	2	have	2	reported	1	positive-tests	1	after	1	were	1	deemed	1	to	1	recovered	1	from	1	the-disease.	1
6520	vietnam	1	deputy	1	minister	1	of	1	health	1	nguyen	1	thanh	1	long	1	also	1	agreed	1	with	1	the-above-opinion,	1	saying	1	that	1	maybe	1	the-patient	1	has	2	not	2	fully	1	recovered	1	during	1	the-treatment-process	1	so	1	sars-cov-2-virus	1	been	1	completely	1	eliminated	1	and	1	still	1	exists	1	in	2	the-body,	1	especially	1	lung-mucous-cells.	1

6523	testing	1	===	1
6524	on	1	30-january	1	2020,	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	science	1	and	2	technology	1	had	1	a-meeting	1	with	1	medical-experts	1	to	2	propose	1	solutions	1	contain	1	mitigate	1	covid-19.	1
6525	starting	1	in	2	early-february,	1	publicly-funded-institutions	1	vietnam	1	developed	1	at-least-four-locally-made-covid-19-tests	1	that	1	were	1	validated	1	by	1	the-ministry	1	of	2	defense	1	and	2	the-national-institute	1	hygiene	1	epidemiology.	1
6526	after	1	being	1	licensed	1	by	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	health,	1	20-countries	1	have	1	ordered	1	the-test-kit.	1
6527	20-countries	1	will	1	be	1	malaysia,	1	iran,	1	finland	1	and	1	ukraine,	1	as	1	of	4	17-march	1	2020.in	1	august	1	2020,	1	the-ministry	1	health	1	approved	1	the-use	1	genexpert,	1	a-type	1	test	1	that	1	has	1	been	1	used	1	by	1	the-vietnam-tuberculosis-prevention-network	1	since	1	2012,	1	for	1	covid-19-testing.	1
6528	plans	1	are	1	underway	1	to	1	further	1	expand	1	the-use	1	of	1	genexpert	2	using	1	14,000	1	covid-19	1	cartridges	1	in	1	42-46-lung-hospitals	1	around	1	the-country.	1
6529	as	1	of	2	april	1	2021,	1	vietnam	1	has	1	169-laboratories	1	capable	1	testing	1	for	1	covid-19	1	using	1	rt-pcr.	1
6530	the-maximum-capacity	1	in	1	the-country	1	remains	1	at	1	62,593-tests	1	per	1	day.	1
6531	during	1	the-outbreak	1	in	2	hải-dương,	1	instead	1	of	3	mass-testing	1	on	1	every-person	1	the-infected-area,	1	the	1	authorities	1	using	1	different-strategies	1	including	1	targeted-testing	1	higher-risk-groups	1	as	2	well	1	random-testing	1	households	1	and	1	inpatients.	1
6532	vietnam	1	has	1	prepared	1	for	1	the-epidemic	1	as	2	early	1	the-very-first-case	1	in	1	china	1	emerged,	1	around	1	mid-december	1	2019.	1
6533	vietnam's-prime-minister	1	nguyễn-xuân-phúc	1	ordered	1	measures	1	to	3	prevent	1	and	1	counter	1	the-spread	1	of	1	the-disease	1	into	1	vietnam,	1	as	2	well	1	warn	1	vietnamese	1	citizens	1	avoid	1	visiting	1	areas	1	with	1	outbreaks.	1

6535	according	1	to	2	kidong-park,-world-health-organization-representative	1	vietnam,	1	the-first-risk-assessment-exercise	1	was	1	conducted	1	by	1	the	1	vietnamese	1	in	2	early-january	1	–	1	soon	1	after	1	cases	1	china	1	started	1	being	1	reported.	1
6536	on	1	3-january	1	2020,	1	the	1	day	1	before	1	the-who	1	said	1	there	1	was	1	a-cluster	1	of	1	cases	1	in	1	wuhan,	1	vietnam	1	tightened	1	control	1	at	1	the-border	1	with	1	chinachina	1	.	1
6537	on	1	11-january	1	2020,	1	after	1	china	1	reported	1	the-first-coronavirus-death,	1	vietnam	1	implemented	1	health-checks	1	at	1	airports.	1
6538	the-ministry	1	of	1	health	1	held	1	a-meeting	1	with	1	the-who	1	and	2	the-us-centers	1	for	1	disease-control	1	prevention	1	(cdc)	1	as	2	early	1	15	1	january,	1	weeks	1	before	1	many-other-countries	1	even	1	started	1	strategizing.	1
6539	these-combined-efforts	1	of	2	quick-action	1	and	1	effective-testing	1	helped	1	slow	1	the-spread	1	the-virus	2	in	1	earliest	1	stages.	1
6540	regional-covid-19-prevention-task-forces	1	were	2	established,	1	and	1	many-other-countries	1	prepared	1	for	1	deployment	1	by	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	health	1	to	1	provincial-treatment-sites.	1
6541	on	1	22-january,	1	health-authorities	1	began	1	monitoring	1	body-temperatures	1	at	1	border-gates	1	and	3	started	1	detection	1	contact-tracing,	1	with	1	orders	1	for	1	the-mandatory-isolation	1	of	1	infected-people	2	anyone	1	had	1	come	1	into	1	contact	1	with.	1
6542	on	1	23-january,	1	vietnam	2	confirmed	1	first	1	case.	1
6543	shortly	1	afterward,	1	the-prime-minister	1	nguyễn-xuân-phúc	1	ramped	1	up	1	vietnam's-response	1	by	1	issuing	1	an-urgent-document	1	to	2	ministries,	1	provinces,	1	and	2	broadcasting-agencies	1	addressing	1	the-dangerousness	1	of	1	the-virus	1	the-need	1	for	1	measures	1	prevent	1	local-transmission.	1
6544	on	1	24-january,	1	just	1	one	1	day	1	after	1	the-first-cases,	1	the-civil-aviation-administration	1	of	2	vietnam	1	ordered	1	the-cancellation	1	all-flights	1	from	1	and	1	to	1	wuhan.	1

6546	on	1	31-january,	1	infectious-disease-expert-nguyễn-thanh-long	1	was	1	appointed	1	as	3	deputy-minister	1	of	3	health	1	and	1	later	1	minister	1	health,	1	he	1	served	1	one	1	the-main-government-advisors	1	regarding	1	the-pandemic.	1
6547	on	1	the-same-day,	1	vietnam	1	implemented	1	stricter-measures,	1	suspending	1	inbound-and-outbound-flights	1	related	1	to	1	the-epicenters	1	in	1	china,	1	restricting	1	tourists,	1	dosing	1	train	1	connection,	1	and	2	suggested	1	people	1	suspend	1	trade	1	other-exchange-activities	1	between	1	the-two-countries.	1
6548	such-a-decision	1	to	2	limit	1	cross-border-transactions	1	with	1	china	1	indicated	1	the-extent	1	of	1	the-government's-commitment	1	prioritizing	1	public-health.	1
6549	in	1	january,	1	the-government	1	also	1	issued	1	the-first-national-response-plan	1	and	1	assembled	1	the-national-steering-committee	1	(nsc).	1
6550	the-committee,	1	led	1	by	1	deputy-prime-minister-vũ-đức-đam	1	with	1	representation	1	from	1	14-ministries	1	and	3	sectors,	1	the-national-assembly,	1	media,	1	information-technology-companies	1	will	1	command	1	control	1	the-country	1	covid-19-response.	1
6551	vietnam	1	also	1	has	1	63-provincial-health-departments,	1	an-approximately-600-district-health-centers	1	and	1	more-than-11,000-primary-health-stations.	1
6552	while	1	hospitals	1	provide	1	medical-care	1	for	3	covid-19-patients,	1	the-primary-health-stations	1	are	1	responsible	1	prevention-activities	1	and	1	total-support	1	hospitals.	1
6553	in	1	february	1	2020,	1	vietnamese-ministry	1	of	5	education	1	and	2	training	1	suspended	1	all-school-activities	1	across	1	the-country	1	until	2	the-end	1	march	1	as	1	part	1	quarantine-measures	1	against	1	the-spreading	1	the-virus,	1	later	1	extended	1	this	1	till	1	the-middle	1	april	1	further-notice.	1
6554	sixty-eight-military-camps	1	with	1	a-capacity	1	of	1	40,000-people	1	were	1	set	1	up	1	to	1	receive	1	people	1	ordered	1	into	1	quarantine.	1
6555	on	2	9-february,	1	the-ministry	1	of	1	health	1	held	1	a-teleconference	1	with	1	the-who-and-700-hospitals	1	at	1	all-levels	1	nationwide	1	to	3	disseminate	2	information	2	ncov-prevention	1	and	1	launched	1	a-website	1	the-wider-public.	1
6556	the-first-case	1	of	2	mass-quarantine	1	in	2	vietnam	1	took	1	place	1	on	1	february	1	12	1	sơn-lôi,	1	vĩnh-phúc,	1	an-community	1	10,000-people	1	for	1	20-days	1	over	1	seven-coronavirus-cases	1	–	1	the-first-large-scale-lockdown	1	known	1	outside	1	china.	1
6557	aggressive-preventive-action	1	enabled	1	vietnam	1	to	1	contain	1	the-outbreak,	1	with	1	only-16-cases,	1	all	1	recovered,	1	by	1	the-end	1	of	1	february.	1
6558	on	1	the-night	1	of	4	6-march,	1	when	1	the-17th-case	1	was	1	reported	1	in	1	hanoi,	1	hanoi	1	held	1	an-urgent-meeting,	1	then	1	coordinated	1	with	1	related-ministries	1	—	2	including	1	the-ministry	1	health,	1	ministry	2	public-security,	1	and	1	transportation	1	to	2	prevent	1	the-virus	1	from	1	spreading	1	the-community.	1
6559	thanks	1	to	2	this-effective-coordination,	1	public-health-measures	1	such	1	as	1	aggressive-contact-tracing,	1	mandatory-quarantine,	1	and	2	sterilization	1	of	1	surfaces	1	were	1	taken	1	immediately,	1	which	1	enabled	1	the-government	1	stop	1	community-transmission	1	lift	1	the-large-scale-lockdown	1	still	1	common	1	in	1	many-southeast-asian-nations	1	at	1	that-time.	1
6560	on	1	march	1	7,	1	hanoi	1	locked	1	down	1	bach-truc-street,	1	where	1	the-patient	1	resided	1	along	1	with	1	66-households	1	and	1	189-people.	1
6561	the-quarantine	1	was	1	lifted	1	on	1	march	1	20	1	after	2	no-new-cases	1	were	1	reported	1	testing.	1
6562	imported-cases	1	from	1	europe	1	motivated	1	the-government	2	to	1	intensify	1	border	1	control	1	measures,	1	reducing	1	international-flights,	1	suspending	1	visa-waiver	1	for	1	certain	1	european	1	countries.	1
6563	when	1	the-bạch-mai-hospital	1	in	2	hanoi	1	became	1	a-coronavirus-hotspot	1	with	1	dozens	1	of	1	cases	1	late-march,	1	the-authorities	2	imposed	1	a-lockdown	1	on	1	the-facility	1	and	2	tracked	1	down	1	nearly-100,000-people	1	related	1	to	1	the-hospital,	1	including	1	medics,	1	patients,	1	visitors	1	close	1	contacts.	1
6564	from	1	16-april,	1	local-airlines	1	could	1	raise	1	the-number	1	of	1	domestic-flights,	1	which	1	were	1	subsequently	1	further	1	increased	1	on	2	23-april	1	and	1	again	1	29-april.	1
6565	on	1	the-same-day,	1	schools	1	across	1	the-country	1	could	1	be	1	re-opened,	1	with	1	dates	1	varying	1	per	1	each-province-and-city-case.	1
6566	everyone	1	who	1	enters	1	vietnam	1	from	1	abroad,	1	however,	1	continued	1	to	1	be	1	quarantined	1	upon	1	arrival	1	for	1	14-days.	1
6567	from	1	23-april,	1	plans	1	for	1	repatriation-flights	1	to	2	bring	1	vietnamese-citizens	1	abroad	1	back	1	vietnam	1
6568	among	1	the-flights	1	conducted	1	was	1	notably	1	the-first-ever-direct-flight	1	in	1	history	1	operated	1	by	1	vietnam-airlines	1	from	2	vietnam	1	to	1	the-united-states	1	on	1	7-may.	1	9-may,	1	cinemas	1	were	1	reopened.	1
6569	lockdown	1	of	1	da-nang	1	===	1

6740	post-mortem-tests	1	are	1	routinely	1	carried	1	out,	1	and	1	there	1	is	1	no-distinction	1	between	1	people	1	who	1	died	1	"with"	1	or	1	"of"-coronavirus,	1	including	1	patients	1	with	1	pre-existing-conditions,	1	which	1	make	1	up	1	96%	1	of	1	the-total-death-count.	1

6886	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19),	1	also	1	known	1	as	1	the-coronavirus	1	or	1	covid,	1	is	1	a-contagious-disease	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
6887	the-first-known-case	1	was	1	identified	1	in	2	wuhan,	1	china,	1	december	1	2019.	1
6888	symptoms	1	of	2	covid-19	1	are	1	variable,	1	but	1	often	1	include	1	fever,	1	cough,	1	headache,	1	fatigue,	1	breathing	1	difficulties,	1	and	2	loss	1	smell	1	taste.	1
6889	symptoms	1	may	1	begin	1	one	1	to	2	fourteen	1	days	1	after	1	exposure	1	the-virus.	1
6890	at-least-a-third	1	of	1	people	1	who	1	are	1	infected	1	do	1	not	1	develop	1	noticeable-symptoms.	1
6891	transmission	1	of	1	covid-19	1	occurs	1	mainly	1	when	1	an-infected-person	1	is	1	in	1	close-contact	1	with	1	another-person.	1
6892	small-droplets	1	containing	1	the-virus	1	can	1	spread	1	from	1	an-infected-person's-nose	1	and	1	mouth	1	as	1	they	1	breathe,	1	cough,	1	sneeze,	1	sing,	1	or	1	speak.	1
6893	other-people	2	are	1	infected	1	if	1	the-virus	1	gets	1	into	1	mouth,	1	nose	1	or	1	eyes.	1
6894	less	1	commonly,	1	the-virus	1	may	1	spread	1	via	1	contaminated-surfaces.	1
6895	people	3	who	3	are	2	infected	2	can	2	transmit	1	the-virus	1	to	2	another-person	1	up	1	two	1	days	1	before	1	show-symptoms,	1	as	1	do	1	not	1	experience	1	symptoms.	1
6896	people	1	remain	1	infectious	1	for	1	up-to-ten-days	1	after	1	the-onset	1	of	1	symptoms	1	in	2	moderate-cases	1	and	1	up-to-twenty-days	1	severe-cases.	1

6952	for	2	areas	1	where	1	commercial-hand-sanitisers	1	are	1	not	1	readily	1	available,	1	the-who	1	provides	1	two-formulations	1	local-production.	1
6953	if	1	a-person	1	touches	1	the-dirty-surface,	1	they	1	may	1	deposit	1	the-virus	2	at	1	the-eyes,	1	nose,	1	or	1	mouth	1	where	1	can	1	enter	1	the-body	1	and	1	cause	1	infection.	1
6954	the-amount	1	of	2	time	1	that	1	the-virus	1	can	1	survive	1	depends	1	significantly	1	on	1	the-type	1	surface,	1	the-temperature,	1	and	1	the-humidity.	1
6955	like	1	other-enveloped-viruses,	1	sars-cov-2	1	survives	1	longest	1	when	2	the-temperature	1	is	2	at	2	room-temperature	1	or	2	lower,	1	and	2	the-relative-humidity	1	low-(<50%).on-many-surfaces,	1	including	1	as	1	glass,	1	some-types	1	of	1	plastic,	1	stainless-steel,	1	skin,	1	the-virus	1	can	1	remain	1	infective	1	for	1	several-days	1	indoors	1	room-temperature,	1	even	1	about	1	a	1	week	1	under	1	ideal-conditions.	1
6956	on	1	some-surfaces,	1	including	1	cotton-fabric	1	and	1	copper,	1	the-virus	1	usually	1	dies	1	after	1	a-few-hours.	1
6957	as	1	a-rule	1	of	1	thumb,	1	the-virus	1	dies	1	faster	1	on	2	porous-surfaces	1	than	1	non-porous-surfaces.	1
6958	the-severity	1	of	1	covid-19	1	varies.	1
6959	the-disease	1	may	1	take	1	a-mild-course	1	with	1	few-or-no-symptoms,	1	resembling	1	other-common-upper-respiratory-diseases	1	such	1	as	1	the-common-cold.	1
6960	in	1	3–4%	1	of	1	cases	1	(7.4%	1	for	1	those	1	over	1	age	1	65)	1	symptoms	1	are	1	severe	1	enough	1	to	1	cause	1	hospitalization.	1
6961	the-italian-istituto-superiore-di-sanità	1	reported	1	that	1	the-median-time	1	between	1	the-onset	1	of	1	symptoms	1	and	1	death	1	was	1	twelve-days,	1	with	1	seven	1	being	1	hospitalised.	1
6962	however,	1	people	1	transferred	1	to	1	an-icu	1	had	1	a-median-time	1	of	1	ten-days	1	between	1	hospitalisation	1	and	1	death.	1
6963	prolonged-prothrombin-time	1	and	2	elevated-c-reactive-protein-levels	1	on	1	admission	1	to	3	the-hospital	1	are	1	associated	1	with	3	severe-course	1	of	2	covid-19	2	a-transfer	1	icu.some	1	early-studies	1	suggest	1	10%	1	20%	1	people	1	will	1	experience	1	symptoms	1	lasting	1	longer	1	than	1	a-month.	1

6981	the-socioeconomic-status	1	can	1	also	1	affect	1	the-number	1	of	1	people	1	affected	1	by	1	covid-19.	1
6982	the-mortality-rate	1	reflects	1	the-number	1	of	2	deaths	1	within	1	a-specific-demographic-group	1	divided	1	by	1	the-population	1	that-demographic-group.	1
6983	consequently,	1	the-mortality-rate	1	reflects	1	the-prevalence	1	as	2	well	1	the-severity	1	of	1	the-disease	1	within	1	a-given-population.	1
6984	for	2	example,	1	the-case-fatality-rate	1	covid-19	1	is	1	lower	1	in	3	india	2	than	2	the-us	1	since	1	younger	1	population	1	represents	1	a-larger-percentage	1	the-us.the	1	case	1	fatality	1	rate	1	(cfr)	1	reflects	1	the-number	2	of	2	deaths	1	divided	1	by	1	diagnosed-cases	1	within	1	a-given-time-interval.	1
6985	the-number	1	varies	1	by	1	region.	1
6986	a-key-metric	1	in	1	gauging	1	the-severity	1	of	1	covid-19	1	is	1	the-infection-fatality-rate	1	(ifr),	1	also	1	referred	1	to	1	as	1	the-infection-fatality-ratio	1	or	1	infection-fatality-risk.	1
6987	this-metric	1	is	1	calculated	1	by	2	dividing	1	the-total-number	2	of	2	deaths	1	from	1	the-disease	1	infected-individuals;	1	hence,	1	in	1	contrast	1	to	1	the-cfr,	1	the-ifr	1	incorporates	1	asymptomatic-and-undiagnosed-infections	1	as	2	well	1	reported-cases.	1
6988	a	1	december-2020-systematic-review	1	and	4	meta-analysis	1	estimated	1	that	1	the-ifr	2	during	1	the-first-wave	1	of	1	the-pandemic	1	was	1	about-0.5%-to-1%	1	in	3	many-locations	1	(including	1	france,	1	netherlands,	1	new-zealand,	1	portugal),	1	1%-to-2%	1	other-locations	1	(australia,	1	england,	1	lithuania,	1	spain),	1	exceeded	1	2%	1	italy.	1

7202	this-article	1	covers	1	the-detailed-statistics	1	of	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	australia.	1
7203	cases	1	===	1	====	1
7204	the-numbers	1	of	3	cases	2	in	1	the-tables	1	below	1	referred	1	to	1	the-number	1	at	1	the-end	1	each-day	1	(23:59-aedt)	1	until	1	4-april	1	2020.	1
7205	the-data	1	has	1	been	1	compiled	1	by	1	recording	1	the-daily-values	1	from	1	the-infographic	1	available	1	under	1	"current-status"	1	on	1	the	1	australian	1	government's	1	department	1	of	1	health	1	website.	1
7206	under	1	national-notifiable-diseases-surveillance-system-reporting-requirements,	1	cases	2	are	1	reported	1	based	1	on	1	australian-jurisdiction	1	of	1	residence	1	rather	1	than	1
7207	where	1	cases	1	were	1	detected.	1
7208	the-following-charts	1	represent	1	changes	1	in	2	net-number	1	of	2	cases	2	on	2	a-daily-basis	1	and	1	is	1	based	1	the-number	1	reported	1	the-australian-government's-daily-reports.	1
7209	as	1	of	2	29-april	1	2021,	1	there	1	are	1	276-active-cases	1	covid-19	1	in	1	australia.	1
7210	a-case	1	is	1	considered	1	active	1	if	1	a	1	person	1	who	1	was	1	covid-19	1	positive	1	but	1	has	2	yet	1	to	1	be	1	classified	1	as	1	recovered	1	and	1	not	1	died.	1
7211	deaths	1	===	1
7212	as	1	of	1	29-april	1	2021,	1	910-people	1	linked	1	to	1	covid-19	1	have	1	died	1	in	1	australia.	1
7213	covid-19-clusters	1	are	2	cases	1	that	1	known	1	to	1	be	1	related	1	by	1	close-contacts.	1
7214	a-single-cluster	1	may	1	have	1	cases	1	in	1	multiple-locations.	1
7215	the-worst-nursing-home-cluster	1	in	2	australia	1	was	1	at	1	st-basil's-homes	1	for	1	the-aged	1	victoria,	1	where	1	45-residents	1	died.	1
7216	cases	1	by	1	source	1	of	1	infection	1	===	1
7217	high-numbers	1	of	4	cases	1	with	1	unknown-sources	1	infection	1	indicates	1	high-risk	1	community-transmission	1	and	2	increased-difficulty	1	in	1	tracing	1	stopping	1	the-spread	1	covid-19.	1

7220	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	united-states-virgin-islands	1	is	1	part	1	of	4	the-ongoing-global-viral-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19),	1	which	1	was	1	reported	1	to	2	have	1	spread	1	the-u.s.-territory	1	the-virgin-islands	1	with	1	the-first-confirmed-case	1	covid-19	1	on	1	march	1	13,	1	2020.	1
