7232	as	1	of	2	april,	1	brazil,	1	with	1	over-14-million-confirmed-cases	1	and	3	over-390,000-deaths,	1	has	1	the-third-highest-number	1	confirmed-cases	1	second-highest-death-toll	1	from	1	covid-19	1	in	1	the-world,	1	behind	1	only-the-united-states	1	india.	1

7235	:	1	two-raw-sewage-samples	1	collected	1	independently	1	on	1	27-november	1	2019	1	in	3	santa-catarina,	1	brazil,	1	will	1	later	1	detect	1	sars-cov-2	1	(100,000-copies	1	per	1	litre),	1	66	1	days	1	advance	1	of	1	the	1	first	1	covid-19	1	confirmed	1	case	1	the-americas.	1

7639	march	1	to	1	april	1	2020	1	==	1
7640	by	1	march	1	11,	1	the-virus	1	had	1	spread	1	to	1	110-countries,	1	and	1	the	1	who	1	officially	1	declared	1	a-pandemic.	1
7641	the-cdc	1	had	1	already	1	warned	1	that	1	large-numbers	1	of	1	people	1	needing	1	hospital-care	1	could	1	overload	1	the-healthcare-system,	1	which	1	would	1	lead	1	to	1	otherwise-preventable-deaths.	1
7642	dr.-anthony-fauci	1	said	1	the-mortality	1	from	1	the-coronavirus	1	was	1	10	1	times	1	higher	1	than	1	the-common-flu.	1
7643	by	1	march	1	12,	1	diagnosed-cases	1	of	1	covid-19	1	in	1	the-u.s.	1	exceeded	1	a	1	thousand.	1

7646	however,	1	the-number	1	of	2	available-test-kits	1	remained	1	limited,	1	which	1	meant	1	the-true-number	1	people	1	infected	1	had	1	to	1	be	1	estimated.	1
7647	as	1	cases	1	began	2	spreading	1	throughout	1	the-nation,	1	federal-and-state-agencies	1	taking	1	urgent-steps	1	to	1	prepare	1	for	1	a-surge	1	of	1	hospital-patients.	1
7648	among	1	the-actions	1	was	1	establishing	1	additional-places	1	for	1	patients	1	in	1	case-hospitals	1	became	1	overwhelmed.	1
7649	throughout	1	march	1	and	3	early-april,	1	several-state,	2	city,	2	county	2	governments	2	imposed	1	"stay	1	at	1	home"-quarantines	1	on	1	populations	1	to	1	stem	1	the-spread	1	of	1	the-virus.	1
7650	by	1	march	1	27,	1	the-country	1	had	1	reported	1	over-100,000-cases.	1

7660	u.s.	1	passed	1	five-million-covid-19-cases	1	by	1	august	1	8.on	1	july	1	10,	1	the-world-health-organization	1	adopted	1	the-infection-fatality-ratio	1	(ifr),	1	"the-number	1	of	2	individuals	1	who	1	die	1	the-disease	1	among	1	all-infected-individuals	1	(symptomatic	1	and	2	asymptomatic)",	1	as	1	a-new-metric	1	for	1	disease-severity,	1	replacing	1	the-symptomatic-case-fatality-ratio	1	the-symptomatic-case-hospitalization-ratio.	1

7698	initial-response	1	outside	1	the-u.s.	1	===	1
7699	on	1	january	1	6,	1	a	1	week	1	after	1	the-u.s.	1	was	1	informed	1	about	1	the-outbreak	1	in	1	china,	1	both-the-health-and-human-services-department	1	and	1	the-cdc	1	offered	1	to	2	send	1	a-team	1	of	1	u.s.-health-experts	1	china.	1
7700	according	1	to	3	the-cdc-director-robert-r.-redfield,	1	china	3	refused	1	let	1	in,	1	which	1	contributed	1	the-u.s.	1	getting	1	a-late-start	1	in	1	identifying	1	the-danger	3	of	3	outbreak	1	and	1	containing	1	their-outbreak	2	before	1	reached	1	other-countries.	1
7701	secretary-alex-azar	1	said	1	china	1	did	1	notify	1	the-world	2	much	1	sooner	1	than	1	the-danger	2	of	2	their-outbreak	2	had	1	after	1	sars-outbreak	1	in	1	2003,	1	but	1	was	1	unexplainably	1	turning	1	away	1	the-cdc-help	1	for	1	this	1	new	1	one.	1
7702	on	1	january	1	28,	1	the-cdc	3	updated	1	china	1	travel	1	recommendations	1	to	1	level	1	3,	1	highest	1	alert.	1
7703	azar	2	submitted	1	names	1	of	1	u.s.-experts	1	to	1	the-who	1	and	1	said	1	u.s.	1	would	1	provide	1	$105	1	million	2	in	1	funding,	1	adding	1	that	1	had	1	requested	1	another	1	$136	1	from	1	congress.	1

7705	a-team	1	of	2	international-experts	1	consisted	1	thirteen-international-researchers,	1	including	1	two-americans,	1	and	1	toured	1	five-cities	1	in	1	china	1	with	1	twelve-local-scientists	1	to	1	study	1	the-epidemic	1	february	1	16–23.	1

7710	testing	1	====	1
7711	testing	1	for	1	sars-cov-2	1	can	1	allow	1	healthcare-workers	1	to	1	identify	1	infected-people.	1
7712	testing	1	for	1	sars-cov-2	1	is	1	also	1	an-important-component	1	of	1	tracking	1	the-pandemic.	1
7713	a-report	1	published	1	in	2	january	1	2021	1	revealed	1	that	1	a-chinese-firm,	2	bgi-group,	1	was	1	attempting	1	to	2	distribute	1	bgi-group	1	covid-19-testing-kits	1	at-least-11-states	1	the-us.	1
7714	however,	1	federal-agencies,	1	including	1	the-food-and-drug-administration	1	and	2	the-federal-emergency-management-agency,	1	as	2	well	1	the-united-states-department	1	of	1	health	1	human-services	1	were	1	pushing	1	the-states	1	to	1	use	1	the-bgi-testing-kits,	1	despite	1	such-warnings.	1
7715	privacy-concerns	1	have	1	prevented	1	measures	1	such	1	as	1	those	1	imposed	1	in	1	south-korea	1	where	1	authorities	1	used	1	cellphone-tracking-and-credit-card-details	1	to	1	locate	1	and	1	test	1	thousands	1	of	1	nightclub-patrons	1	when	1	new-cases	1	began	1	emerging.	1
7716	the-cost	1	rises	1	with	1	the-number	1	of	1	infections,	1	and	1	contact-tracing	1	is	2	easier	1	to	1	implement	1	when	1	the-infection-count	1	lower.	1
7717	as	2	of	2	july	1	1,	1	only-four-states	2	are	1	using	1	contact	1	tracing	1	apps	1	part	1	state-level	1	strategies	1	to	1	control	1	transmission.	1
7718	in	2	november	1	2020,	1	the-fda	1	issued	1	an-emergency-use-authorization	1	(eua)	1	for	2	the-combination	1	of	3	baricitinib	1	with	1	remdesivir,	1	the-treatment	1	suspected	1	or	3	laboratory	1	confirmed	1	covid-19	1	hospitalized-people	1	two-years	1	age	1	older	1	requiring	1	supplemental-oxygen,	1	invasive-mechanical-ventilation,	1	extracorporeal-membrane-oxygenation	1	(ecmo).	1
7719	as	1	of	2	august	1	2020,	1	there	1	were	1	more-than-500-potential-therapies	1	for	1	covid‑19-disease	1	in	1	various-stages	1	preclinical-or-clinical-research.	1
7720	on	1	march	1	28,	1	the-fda	1	issued	1	an-emergency-use-authorization	1	(eua)	1	which	1	allowed	1	certain	1	hospitalized	1	covid-19-patients	1	to	1	be	1	treated	1	with	1	hydroxychloroquine	1	or	1	chloroquine.	1

7793	international-views	1	of	1	the-united-states	1	====	1

7795	the-outbreak	1	prompted	1	calls	1	for	2	the-united-states	1	to	1	adopt	1	social-policies	1	common	1	in	1	other-wealthy-countries,	1	including	1	universal-health-care,	1	universal-child-care,	1	paid	1	sick-leave,	1	and	1	higher-levels	1	of	1	funding	1	public-health.	1
7796	as	1	a-result,	1	many-people	1	believe	1	falsehoods,	1	for	1	example,	1	that	3	wearing	1	masks	1	is	2	dangerous,	1	a-global-syndicate	1	planned	1	the-virus,	1	or	1	covid-19	1	a-hoax.	1
7797	president-trump	1	repeatedly	1	broadcast	1	misinformation	1	to	2	downplay	1	the-threat	1	of	2	the-virus	1	and	1	deflect	1	criticism	1	the-administration's-response.	1
7798	the-pandemic,	1	along	1	with	1	the-resultant-stock-market-crash	1	and	1	other-impacts,	1	led	1	a-recession	1	in	2	the-united-states	1	following	1	the-economic-cycle-peak	1	february	1	2020.	1
7799	the-economy	1	contracted	1	4.8-percent	1	from	1	january	1	through	1	march	1	2020,	1	and	1	the-unemployment-rate	1	rose	1	to	1	14.7-percent	1	in	1	april.	1
7800	as	1	of	1	june	1	2020,	1	the-u.s.-economy	2	was	2	over	1	ten	1	percent	1	smaller	1	than	1	in	1	december	1	2019.	1
7801	the-economic-impact-and-mass-unemployment	1	caused	1	by	2	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	has	1	raised	1	fears	1	of	1	a-mass-eviction-crisis,	1	with	1	an-analysis	1	the-aspen-institute	1	indicating	1

7969	as	1	of	1	24-march	1	2021,	1	there	1	have	1	been	1	4.3-million-cases	1	confirmed	1	and	2	126,172-deaths	1	overall	1	among	1	people	1	who	1	had	1	recently	1	tested	1	positive	1	–	1	the-world's-eleventh-highest-death-rate	1	by	1	population	1	the-highest-death-toll	1	in	1	europe.	1

7972	on	1	23-march	1	2020,	1	the-uk	1	went	1	into	1	lockdown.	1
7973	people	1	were	1	told	1	to	1	keep	1	apart	1	in	1	public.	1
7974	lockdown	1	was	1	also	1	forecast	1	to	2	worsen	1	mental-health-and-suicide-rates,	1	and	2	cause	1	further-deaths	1	due	1	isolation,	1	delays	1	falling-living-standards.	1

7976	in	1	late-april,	1	prime-minister-boris-johnson	1	said	1	the-uk	2	had	1	passed	1	the-peak	1	of	1	outbreak.	1
7977	daily-cases	1	and	2	deaths	1	fell	1	in	1	may–june,	1	stayed	1	at	1	low-levels	1	over	1	the-summer.	1
7978	the-lockdown	1	was	1	gradually	1	eased	1	in	1	june–july,	1	while	1	schools	1	remained	1	closed	1	for	1	summer-break.	1
7979	in	3	england,	1	tiered-restrictions	2	were	2	introduced	2	october,	1	scotland	1	went	1	into	1	a-month-long-lockdown	1	(excluding	1	schools)	1	during	1	november,	1	and	1	new	1	december.	1

7988	the-case-fatality-ratio	1	for	1	covid-19	1	has	2	been	2	much	1	lower	1	than	1	sars	1	of	1	2003,	1	but	1	the-transmission	1	significantly	1	greater,	1	with	1	a-significant-total-death-toll.	1

8064	on	1	14-april,	1	figures	1	released	1	by	1	the-office	1	for	1	national-statistics	1	indicated	1	that	1	coronavirus	1	had	1	been	1	linked	1	to	1	one	1	in	1	five-deaths	1	during	1	the-week	1	ending	1	3	1	april.	1

8066	on	2	that-day,	1	nhs-england	2	and	3	the-care-quality-commission	2	began	1	rolling	1	out	1	tests	1	for	1	care-home-staff	1	residents	1	as	1	was	2	reported	1	the-number	1	of	2	care-home-deaths	1	rising	1	but	1	that	1	official-figures,	1	which	1	relied	1	death-certificates,	1	were	1	not	1	reflecting	1	the-full-extent	1	the-problem.	1
8067	also	1	on	1	15-april,	1	arlene-foster,	1	the-first-minister	1	of	2	northern-ireland,	1	extended	1	the-period	1	lockdown	1	in	1	northern-ireland	1	to	1
8068	on	1	that-day	1	the-number	2	of	3	care-home-deaths	1	increased	1	by	1	861	1	to	2	13,729,	1	while	1	cases	1	the-virus	1	passed	1	100,000,	1	reaching	1	103,093.on	1	18-april,	1	unions	1	representing	1	doctors	1	and	1	nurses	1	expressed	1	concern	1	at	1	a-change	1	in	1	government-guidelines	1	advising	1	medics	1	reuse	1	gowns	1	or	1	wear	1	other-kits	1	if	1	stocks	1	run	1	low.	1
8069	on	1	29-april,	1	the-number	1	of	1	people	1	who	1	had	1	died	1	with	1	coronavirus	1	in	3	the-uk	1	passed	1	26,000,	1	as	2	official-figures	1	include	1	deaths	1	the-community,	1	such	1	care-homes,	1	for	1	the-first-time.	1

8076	on	1	1-june,	1	primary-schools	1	in	1	england	1	reopened	1	to	1	some-reception	1	(4–5-years),-year-1-(5–6-years)	1	and	1	year-6-(10–11-years)	1
8077	on	1	3-june,	1	briefings	1	began	1	(later	1	referred	1	to	2	as	2	'press-conferences')	1	in	2	a-series	1	that	1	was	1	set	1	up	1	by	1	welsh-government	1	a-way	1	of	2	dispersing	1	new-information	1	the-people	1	wales	1	regarding	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	wales.	1
8078	on	1	6-june,	1	parliament-square	1	in	4	london,	1	saw	1	thousands	1	of	2	people	1	participating	1	the-black-lives	1	matter	1	protest	1	against	1	racism	1	and	1	police-violence	1	the-uk,	1	following	1	the-death	1	george-floyd	1	apparently	1	caused	1	by	1	us-police	1	minneapolis,	1	minnesota.	1

8085	on	1	2-july,	1	the-uk-government	1	revised	1	the-total-number	1	of	1	cases	1	down	1	by	1	30,302	1	because	1	some-people	1	were	1	counted	1	twice	1	in	1	the-earlier-figures.	1
8086	the-actual-increase	1	in	1	the-number	1	of	1	cases	1	for	1	2-july	1	was	1	576	1	or	1	0.18%.also	1	on	1	2-july,	1	the-uk-government	1	removed	1	75-countries	2	from	1	the-england-related-quarantine-list	1	since	1	were	1	now	1	dubbed	1	"low	1	risk".	1

8088	public-health-england	1	had	2	said	1	that	2	the-figures	2	for	3	deaths	1	included	1	people	1	tested	1	positive	1	the-virus	1	months	1	before	1	deaths-death.	1
8089	this	1	drew	1	criticism	1	from	1	the-spanish-pm,	1	pedro-sánchez,	1	as	1	the-outbreak	1	was	1	largely	1	only	1	happening	1	in	1	catalonia.	1
8090	on	1	27-july,	1	the	1	first	1	confirmed	1	case	1	of	1	an-animal-infection	1	with	1	sars-cov-2	1	in	2	the-uk	1	was	1	reported,	1	having	1	been	1	detected	1	a-pet-cat.	1
8091	uk-health-officials	1	said	1	that	2	a-pet-cat	2	had	1	probably	1	contracted	1	the-coronavirus	1	from	1	owners,	1	but	1	there	1	was	1	no-evidence	1	pets	1	or	1	other-domestic-animals	1	can	1	transmit	1	the-disease	1	to	1	humans.	1

8093	the-new-lockdown-rules,	1	which	1	came	1	into	1	force	1	at	1	midnight,	1	meant	1	people	1	from	1	different-households	1	were	1	not	1	allowed	1	to	1	meet	1	in	1	homes	1	or	1	private-gardens.	1

8101	september	1	2020	1	===	1
8102	on	1	6-september,	1	concerns	1	were	1	raised	1	over	1	an-increased-number	1	of	1	cases	1	in	1	the-preceding-few-days,	1	a-trend	1	that	1	continued	1	into	1	the-following-week.	1
8103	on	1	8-september,	1	the-government	1	published	1	new-social-distancing-rules	1	to	2	come	1	into	1	effect	1	in	1	england	1	from	1	14-september,	1	wherein	1	all-gatherings	1	of	3	separate-households	1	would	1	be	1	restricted	1	groups	1	six-or-few-people	1	(the-so-called-"rule	1	six"),	1	excluding	1	work	1	or	1	educational-settings.	1
8104	similar-rules	1	were	1	also	1	later	1	announced	1	(to	1	begin	1	on	1	the-same-date)	1	in	2	scotland	1	and	1	wales,	1	although	1	–	2	unlike	1	england	1	with	1	exemptions	1	for	1	young-children.	1
8105	on	2	9-september,	1	these-rules	1	were	1	further	2	elaborated	1	in	1	a-government-press-conference,	1	alongside	1	details	1	of	3	new-legal-requirements	1	for	1	data-gathering	1	behalf	1	venues,-social-distancing-"marshals"	1	to	2	enforce	1	restrictions,	1	and	1	the-outline	1	a-"moonshot"-plan	1	control	1	the-virus	1	with	1	greatly-expanded-mass-virus-testing.	1
8106	a-"moonshot"-plan	1	to	1	further	1	control	1	the-virus	1	with	2	greatly-expanded-mass-virus-testing	1	was	1	derided	1	as	1	lacking	1	expert-input	1	by	1	professor-jon-deeks	1	of	4	the-university	1	birmingham	1	and	1	cochrane,	1	speculating	1	on	1	the-consequences	1	false-positives	1	that	1	might	1	go	1	along	1	testing	1	such-a-large-number	1	people.	1
8107	in	4	september	1	the-bbc	3	decided	1	that	1	would	2	not	1	show	2	every-scottish-briefing	1	on	2	bbc-one-scotland,	1	but	1	take	1	an-editorial-view	3	regards	3	to	4	public-health	3	and	1	continue	1	the-news-channel,	1	took	1	with	1	the-welsh-briefing.	1
8108	on	1	18-september,	1	the-government	1	tightened	1	restrictions	1	further	1	in	1	parts	1	of	2	the-north-east	1	england.	1
8109	pubs	1	were	2	told	1	to	3	close	1	every	1	day	1	from	1	10pm	1	5am,	1	and	1	households	1	not	1	allowed	1	mix.	1
8110	this-decision	1	followed	1	a-warning	1	from	1	the-uk-government's-chief-scientific-advisor	1	earlier	1	that	2	day,	1	the-uk	1	could	1	be	1	seeing	1	50,000-cases	1	a	1	day	1	by	1	october	1	unless	1	further-action	1	was	1	taken	1	to	1	slow	1	the-virus's-spread.	1
8111	fears	1	of	2	a-"second-lockdown"	1	caused	1	a-drop	1	in	1	uk-stocks,	1	although	1	the	1	following	1	day	1	the-prime-minister	1	stated	1	that	1	potential-additional-restrictions	1	would	1	be	1	"by	1	no-means	1	a-return	1	to	1	the-full-lockdown	1	march".	1

8114	october	1	2020:	1

8117	nicola-sturgeon	1	had	1	been	1	suspended	1	from	2	the-snp	1	for	2	travelling	2	scotland	2	to	3	london	1	attend	1	a-coronavirus-debate	1	in	1	the-house	1	of	1	commons	1	while	1	awaiting	1	a-coronavirus-test-result,	1	and	1	then	1	back	1	after	1	testing	1	positive	1	covid-19.	1

8119	the-number	1	of	1	new-cases	1	declared	1	on	1	3-october	1	was	1	approximately-double-the-rate	1	prevailing	1	over	1	the-preceding-few-days.	1

8122	a-smoothed-curve	1	of	1	estimates	1	from	1	the-covid-symptom-study	1	suggested	1	that	1	new-cases	1	might	1	be	2	estimated	1	to	1	running	1	just	1	below	1	8,000	1	per	1	day.	1

8130	on	1	30-october,	1	the-office	1	for	1	national-statistics-weekly-infection-survey	1	in	2	england	1	showed	1	that	1	secondary	1	school	2	children	2	ages	1	11	1	to	3	16	2	had	1	the-fastest-rate	1	of	4	increase	1	covid-19-incidence	1	any-measured-age-range,	1	giving	1	them	1	the-second-highest-average-incidence	1	2.0%	1	any-age-range,	1	fifty	1	times	1	higher	1	than	1	when	1	returned	1	after	1	the-summer-holiday,	1	and	1	slightly	1	behind	1	the	1	24	1	years	1	old	1	age	1	range	1	at	1	2.3%-incidence.	1
8131	on	2	31-october,	1	prime-minister-boris-johnson	1	announced	1	that	1	england	1	would	2	enter	1	a-four-week-national-lockdown	1	5-november,	1	when	1	pubs,	1	restaurants,	1	leisure-centres	1	and	1	non-essential-shops	1	close.	1

8134	november	1	2020:	1

8141	total-deaths	1	in	1	the-uk	1	passed	1	50,000	1	on	1	11-november,	1	the	1	first	1	european	1	nation	1	to	1	do	1	so.	1
8142	it	1	came	1	as	1	the-governments	1	of	2	the-various-countries	1	the-uk	1	announced	1	an-evacuation-style-plan	1	to	2	get	1	university-students	1	home	1	for	1	christmas	1	and	1	continue	1	studying	1	from	1	home.	1
8143	by	1	this-time,	1	the-total-number	1	of	1	cases	1	reported	1	was	2	1,256,725	1	and	1	the-death-toll	1	50,365.	1

8550	oh	1	bee-hiok,	1	a-covid-19-case	1	who	1	was	2	part	1	of	1	the-safra-jurong-cluster	1	in	1	march	1	2020,	1	sentenced	1	to	1	five-months'-imprisonment	1	for	1	deliberately	1	obstructing	1	moh-workers	1	and	1	withholding	1	information.	1

8573	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	bangladesh	1	is	1	part	1	of	2	the-worldwide-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
8574	the-virus	1	was	1	confirmed	1	to	2	have	1	spread	1	bangladesh	1	in	1	march	1	2020.	1
8575	since	1	then,	1	the-pandemic	1	has	2	spread	1	day	2	by	1	over	1	the-whole-nation	1	and	1	the-number	1	of	1	affected-people	1	been	1	increasing.	1
8576	in	1	order	1	to	4	protect	1	the-population,	1	the-government	1	declared	1	"lockdown"	1	throughout	1	the-country	1	from	2	23-march	1	30-may	1	and	1	prepared	1	some-necessary-steps	1	spread	1	awareness	1	keep	1	this-syndrome	1	away	1	awareness.	1
8577	infections	1	remained	1	low	1	until	1	the-end	1	of	1	march	1	but	1	saw	1	a-steep-rise	1	in	1	april.	1

8582	bangladesh	1	reached	1	two-grim-milestones	1	of	3	160,000-cases	1	and	2	2,000-deaths	1	on	1	5-july	1	overtook	1	france	1	in	1	terms	1	the-number	1	cases	1	two	1	days	1	later.	1
8583	the-number	2	of	2	recoveries	1	in	1	the-country	1	exceeded	1	active-cases	1	on	1	12-july.	1
8584	bangladesh	1	is	1	the-third-most-affected-country	1	in	1	south-asia,	1	after	1	india	1	and	1	pakistan.	1
8585	newspaper-reports	1	and	1	social-media	1	continued	1	to	1	report	1	about	1	additional-deaths	1	of	1	patients	1	with	1	covid-19-symptoms.	1
8586	some	1	of	1	the	1	deceased	1	were	3	treated	1	at	2	covid-19-isolation-centres	1	hospitals	1	in	1	the-districts	1	and	1	others	1	denied	1	treatment,	1	though	1	no-tests	1	conducted	1	to	1	confirm	1	contagion.	1

8810	lockdown	1	===	1
8811	on	1	19-march,	1	the-government	1	declared	1	suspension	1	of	5	all-classes	1	and	1	postponement	1	all-academic-examinations	1	including	1	the-secondary-education-examination	1	until	1	12-april,	1	the	1	end	1	the-month	1	chaitra,	1	the-last-month	1	nepali-calendar-year	1	when	1	all-schools	1	hold	1	the-final-examinations.	1
8812	the-country-wide-lockdown	1	came	1	into	1	effect	1	on	1	24-march.	1
8813	there	1	were	1	only-two-confirmed-cases	1	from	1	610-rt-qpcr-tests	1	and	1	no-fatalities	1	when	1	the-government	1	introduced	1	nationwide-lockdown	1
8814	but	1	these-number	1	increased	1	to	1	17,994-positive-cases	1	and	1	40-deaths	1	at	1	the-end	1	of	1	lockdown.	1

8892	this-article	1	presents	1	official-statistics	1	gathered	1	during	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	the-united-states.	1
8893	the-cdc	1	publishes	1	official-numbers,	1	originally	1	every	1	monday,	1	wednesday,	1	and	4	friday	1	reports	1	several-categories	1	of	1	cases:	1	individual-travelers,	1	people	1	who	2	contracted	1	the-disease	2	from	2	other-people	1	within	1	the-u.s.,	1	repatriated	1	citizens	1	returned	1	to	1	the-u.s.	1	crisis-locations,	1	such	1	as	1	wuhan,	1	where	1	originated,	1	the-cruise-ship	1	diamond-princess.	1

8897	coronavirus	1	counts	1	additional-deaths	1	which	1	are	1	not	1	explained	1	by	1	official	1	reported-coronavirus-mortality-statistics.	1

8900	by	1	march	1	26,	1	the-united-states,	1	with	2	the-world's-third-largest-population,	1	surpassed	1	china	1	and	1	italy	1	as	1	the-country	1	the-world's-highest-number	1	of	1	confirmed-cases.	1

9426	some	1	include	1	total-movement-control	1	while	1	others	1	have	1	enforced	1	restrictions	1	based	1	on	1	time.	1

9429	several-researchers,	1	from	1	modelling	1	and	2	demonstrated	1	examples,	1	have	1	concluded	1	that	1	lockdowns	1	are	1	effective	1	at	1	reducing	1	the-spread	1	of,	1

9433	the-relatively-high-number	1	of	2	cases	1	and	2	deaths	1	in	2	sweden,	1	which	1	has	1	kept	1	much	1	sweden	2	society	1	open	1	during	1	the-pandemic,	1	when	1	compared	1	to	3	neighbors	1	with	1	comparable-demographics	1	norway,	1	denmark	1	finland	1	that	1	did	1	enforce	1	lockdowns,	1	is	1	thought	1	at	1	least	1	partly	1	attributable	1	this-difference	1	policy.	1

9464	15-may.-the-state	1	of	2	victoria,	1	particularly-the-country-capital-city	1	melbourne,	1	the-country's-second-most-populous-city	1	with	1	five-million-residents,	1	entered	1	an-extended-lockdown	1	on	1	7-july	1	2020	1	in	1	response	1	to	1	a-rapidly-growing-community-outbreak.	1
9465	initially	1	scheduled	1	to	4	last	1	six-weeks,	1	restrictions	1	were	1	tightened	1	further	2	on	4	2-august	1	after	1	cases	1	continued	1	grow,	1	including	1	a-ban	1	travel	1	than	1	a-five-kilometre-radius	1	from	1	place	1	of	3	residence,	1	a-nighttime-curfew	1	8-pm	1	5-am,	1	a-one-hour-limit	1	outdoor-exercise,	1	a	1	one-person	1	per	1	day	1	limit	1	shopping	1	for	1	essentials,	1	and	1	public-gatherings	1	limited	1	a-maximum	1	two-people.	1
9466	restrictions	1	were	2	progressively	1	eased	1	as	1	the-case-rate	1	declined,	1	and	1	completely	1	lifted	1	on	1	28-october.	1
9467	with	1	a-total-duration	1	of	3	112-days,	1	the-victorian-lockdown	1	was	1	the-longest-continuous-period	1	covid-19-lockdown	1	globally	1	as	1	october	1	2020.brief	1	"	1

9610	covid-19-lockdown	1	in	1	china	1

9612	national-responses	1	to	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1
9613	new-normal-normalization	1	of	1	deviance	1	–	1	one-reason	1	people	1	stop	1	using	1	effective-prevention-measures	1
9614	preventive-action-timeline	1	of	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	==	1
9615	on	1	8-april	1	2020,	1	the-robert-koch-institute	1	began	1	using	1	another-method	1	to	1	estimate	1	the-numbers	1	of	2	recoveries,	1	now	1	also	1	incorporating	1	cases	1	where	1	the-date	1	the-first-symptoms	1	is	1	unknown.	1
9616	new-cases	1	per	1	day	1	====	2
9617	the-robert-koch-institute	1	measures	1	the-reproduction-rate	1	as	1	a-moving-4-day-average	1	of	4	the-number	1	new-symptomatic-cases	1	using	1	a-nowcasting	1	according	1	to	2	the-4-day-average-number	1	new-cases	1	on	1	a-specific-day	1	and	1	comparing	1	it	1	with	1	the-corresponding-mean	1	4	1	days	1	before,	1	reflecting	1	the-spread	1	the-disease	1	roughly	1	one	1	two	1	weeks	1	before	1	any-specific-day.	1
9618	as	1	it	1	is	2	however	1	prone	1	to	1	larger-fluctuation,	1	taking	1	into	1	account	1	possible-delays	1	in	1	reporting,	1	a-7-day-rate	1	then	1	introduced,	1	which	1	compares	1	the-7-day-average	1	of	1	cases	1	at	1	one-specific-date	1	with	1	4	1	days	1	before.	1
9619	above	1	1,	1	the-number	1	of	1	active-infections	1	will	2	grow	1	exponentially	1	,	1	but	1	even	1	below	1	1	1	the-decline	1	be	1	very	1	slow,	1	if	1	re	1	is	1	too	1	close	1	to	1	1.	1
9620	since	1	the-beginning	1	of	2	testing	1	in	2	germany	1	up	1	to	1	and	1	including	1	week	1	11/2021	1	(mar	1	15–21),	1	48,979,281-laboratory-tests	1	at-least-212-laboratories	1	have	2	been	2	recorded,	1	2,955,672	1	which	1	positive.	1
9621	the-number	2	of	3	tests	1	is	1	not	1	the	1	same	1	as	2	persons	1	tested,	1	the-data	1	may	1	include	1	multiple-tests	1	patients.	1
9622	new-deaths	1	per	1	day	1	====	2
9623	testing	1	====	1
9624	on	1	25-march	1	2020,	1	the-restrictive-robert-koch-institute	1	(rki)-testing-criteria	1	announced	1	that	1	people	1	no	1	longer	1	needed	1	to	2	come	1	from	1	risk-areas	1	be	1	tested.	1
9625	mildly-ill-patients	1	would	2	not	1	always	1	be	2	able	1	to	2	get	1	tested,	1	in	1	which-case	1	they	1	asked	1	remain	1	at	1	home	1	and	1	minimise	1	contact	1	with	1	others.	1

9627	cases	1	reported	1	by	2	state-health-departments	1	are	1	added	1	earlier	1	to	2	a-project	1	funke-mediengruppe,	1	which	1	berliner-morgenpost	1	belongs.	1

9629	number	1	of	1	deaths	1	====	1
9630	as	3	of	3	march	1	2020,	1	the-reported-death-rate	1	calculated	1	the-number	2	deaths	1	divided	1	by	1	infected	1	in	2	germany	1	was	1	lower	1	than	1	some-other-areas	1	such	1	italy,	1	for	1	example.	1
9631	this,	1	while	1	virologists,	1	among	1	others	1	the-leader	1	of	2	the-rki,	1	warned	1	that	1	germany	1	was	1	simply	1	at	1	an-earlier-stage	1	the-outbreak	1	and	1	fatalities	1	would	1	soon	1	increase.	1
9632	the-extensive-testing	1	found	1	younger-and-less-sick-people	2	more	1	often:	1	median	1	age	1	was	1	given	1	as	1	47-or-45-years,	1	whereas	1	italy	1	tested	1	older-and-sicker-people	1	at	1	a-median	1	of	1	63-years.	1
9633	many-early-infections	1	happened	1	in	1	skiers	1	returning	1	from	1	tyrol,	1	who	1	tended	1	to	1	be	1	fit	1	people	1	rather	1	than	1	persons	1	at	1	higher-risk	1	of	1	complications,	1	and	1	contributed	1	a-negligible-mortality.	1
9634	since	1	germany	1	has	1	no-routine	1	for	1	post-mortem-tests,	1	unlike	1	italy	1	it	1	may	1	not	1	have	1	discovered	1	all-deaths.	1
9635	the	1	elderly	1	in	2	germany	1	often	1	do	1	not	1	live	1	the-same-household	2	as	1	extended	1	family	1	and	1	this	1	has	1	reduced	1	the-number	1	of	1	infections.	1
9636	germany	1	has	1	many-test-laboratories	1	and	2	a-weekly-test-capacity	1	of	4	160	1	thousand	1	could	1	have	1	a-lower-number	1	unrecorded-cases	1	infections	1	than	1	for	1	example	1	italy,	1	though	1	the-number	1	tests	1	including	1	negative-results	1	was	1	unknown	1	until	1	23-march.	1
9637	italy	1	has	1	several-times-fewer-hospital-beds	1	for	1	intensive-respiratory-care	1	than	1	germany.	1
9638	while	1	italy	1	and	1	spain	1	ran	1	out	1	of	1	beds,	1	german-hospitals	1	still	1	had	1	free-capacity.	1
9639	the-number	2	of	2	beds,	1	protective-gear	1	and	1	medical-personnel	1	can	1	become	1	bottlenecks	1	for	1	providing	1	adequate-care.	1

9641	as	1	a-member	1	of	4	the-ministry's-division	1	km	1	4-critical-infrastructure-protection,	1	kohn	1	devised	1	a-document	1	based	1	on	1	a-large-number	1	statistical-surveys	1	in	1	which	1	he	1	harshly	1	criticised	1	the-government's-assessment	1	and	1	reaction	1	to	1	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	with	1	the-help	1	external-professors	1	(harald-walach,	1	gunnar-heinsohn,	1	stefan-hockertz,	1	andreas-sönnichsen,	1	sucharit-bhakdi,	1	karina-reiß,	1	peter-schirmacher).	1
9642	the-efficacy	1	of	2	a-viral-vector-vaccine	1	for	1	prevention	1	covid-19	2	is	1	76.0%	1	at	2	preventing	1	symptomatic	1	beginning	1	22-days	1	following	1	the-first-dose	1	and	1	81.3%	1	after	1	the-second-dose.	1
9643	a-viral-vector-vaccine	1	for	1	prevention	1	of	1	covid-19	1	has	1	a-good-safety-profile,	1	with	1	side-effects	1	including	1	injection-site-pain,	1	headache,	1	and	1	nausea,	1	all	1	generally	1	resolving	1	within	1	a-few-days.	1

9689	a-subsequent-analysis,	1	published	1	on	1	19-february	1	2021,	1	showed	1	an-efficacy	1	of	1	76.0%	1	at	2	preventing	1	symptomatic	1	covid-19	1	beginning	1	22-days	1	following	1	the-first-dose,	1	increasing	1	to	1	81.3%	1	when	1	the-second-dose	1	is	1	given	1	12-weeks	1	or	1	more	1	after	1	the	1	first.	1
9690	however,	1	the-results	1	did	1	not	1	show	1	any-protection	1	against	1	asymptomatic	1	covid-19	1	following	1	only-one-dose.	1
9691	efficacy	1	was	2	higher	1	at	3	greater-intervals	1	between	1	doses,	1	peaking	1	around-80%	1	when	1	the-second-dose	1	given	1	12-weeks	1	or	1	longer	1	after	1	the	1	first.	1
9692	covid-19	1	vaccines	1	against	1	covid-19-related-hospitalisation	1	in	1	scotland	1	was	1	based	1	on	1	a-national-prospective-cohort-study	1	of	1	5.4-million-people.	1
9693	between	1	8-december	1	2020	1	and	1	15	1	february	1	2021,	1	1,137,775-participants	1	were	2	vaccinated	1	in	1	the-study,	1	490,000	1	of	1	whom	1	given	1	the-oxford–astrazeneca-vaccine.	1
9694	the-first-dose	1	of	2	oxford–astrazeneca-vaccine	1	was	1	associated	1	with	1	a-vaccine-effect	1	94%	1	for	1	covid-19-related-hospitalisation	1	at	1	28–34-days-post-vaccination.	1

9706	canada	1	====	1

9742	provinces	1	and	2	territories	1	have,	1	to	1	varying-degrees,	1	implemented	1	school	1	daycare	1	closures,	1	prohibitions	1	on	2	gatherings,	1	closures	1	of	1	non-essential-businesses,	1	restrictions	1	entry.	1

9751	alarmed	1	by	1	hospital-capacity-issues,	1	fatalities	1	and	4	new-cases,	1	heavy-restrictions	1	(such	1	as	1	lockdowns	1	curfews)	1	were	1	put	1	in	5	place	1	affected-areas	1	(primarily-ontario,	1	quebec	1	alberta)	1	across	1	the-country,	1	which	1	has	1	resulted	1	active-cases	2	beginning	1	to	1	steadily	1	decline,	1	reaching	1	a-plateau	1	mid-february	1	2021.	1

9844	role	1	of	2	the-government	1	canada	1	===	1

9847	samples	1	from	1	suspected-cases	1	early	1	in	1	the-pandemic	1	were	1	sent	1	by	1	provinces	1	and	1	territories	1	to	1	this-national-lab	1	for	1	testing,	1	either	1	as	2	the-sole-test	1	or	1	a-check	1	of	1	an	1	in-province	1	test	1	result.	1

9850	federal-facilitation	1	of	1	testing	1	====	1
9851	in	1	late-april,	1	the-federal-government	1	arranged	1	for	4	a-cargo-flight	1	from	1	china	1	that	1	delivered	1	the-equivalent	1	of	2	about-six-to-nine-months	1	production	1	one-particular-raw-material	1	the-20-odd-raw-materials	1	needed	1	by	1	supplier-luminultra	1	to	1	supply	1	reagent-kits	1	rt-pcr-machines.	1

9856	precision-biomonitoring	1	of	2	guelph	1	signed	1	a-letter	1	intent	1	on	1	march	1	31	1	with	1	the-federal-government	1	to	1	co-develop	1	a	1	novel	1	point-of-care	1	test	1	kit	1	for	1	covid‑19,	1	which	1	is	1	now	1	pending	1	an-authorization	1	from	1	health-canada.	1
9857	since	1	bio-id-diagnostics	3	of	4	edmonton	3	is	1	based	1	on	1	sequencing	1	dna	1	avoids	1	false-positives,	1	and	1	detects	1	a-low-concentration	1	the-virus	1	substantially	1	reducing	1	false-negatives	1	in	1	asymptomatic-individuals.	1

9922	tracking	1	covid-19	1	vaccines	1	in	1	the-us.	1
9923	covid-19	1	community-quarantines	1	in	1	the-philippines	3	are	1	series	1	of	2	stay-at-home	1	orders	1	and	1	cordon-sanitaire-measures	1	implemented	1	by	1	the-government	1	through	1	inter-agency	1	task	1	force	1	on	1	emerging-infectious-diseases	1	(iatf-eid).	1
9924	the	1	strictest	1	of	1	community-quarantines	1	in	1	the-philippines	1	is	2	the-"enhanced-community-quarantine"	1	(ecq),	1	which	1	effectively	1	a-total-lockdown.	1
9925	given	1	the-rapidly-increasing-number	1	of	1	cases	1	in	1	metro-manila,	1
9926	albay-2nd-district-representative-joey-salceda	1	proposed	1	a-week-long-lockdown	1	of	1	the-region	1	to	1	prevent	1	the-disease	1	from	1	spreading	1	nationwide.	1
9927	albay-2nd-district-representative-joey-salceda	1	specifically	1	proposed	1	the-closure	1	of	2	the-philippine-expressway-network	1	and	2	public-transportation	1	accessing	1	the-region,	1	in	1	addition	1	to	1	the-suspension	1	classes	1	work.	1
9928	president-duterte	2	initially	1	rejected	1	the-proposal	1	claiming	1	would	1	"hamper	1	the-flow	1	of	1	basic-commodities".	1
9929	secretary-duque,	1	however,	1	raised	1	the-possibility	1	of	2	a-lockdown	1	on	1	certain-cities	1	or	1	towns	1	if	1	cases	1	community-based-transmissions	1	are	1	reported,	1	but	1	not	1	an	1	entire	1	region.	1
9930	on	2	march	2	12,	1	president-duterte	1	announced	1	a-partial-lockdown	1	covering	1	metro-manila,	1	that	1	began	1	15.	1
9931	at	1	one-point	1	during	1	president-rodrigo-duterte's-pronouncement	1	about	1	the-metro-manila-"community-quarantine,"	1	president-duterte	1	said	1	that	1	"they	1	are	1	afraid	1	to	1	call	1	the-metro-manila-"community-quarantine	2	a-lockdown,	1	but	1	is	1	a-lockdown."	1
9932	secretary-eduardo-año	1	of	2	the-department	1	interior	1	and	1	local	1	government	1	(dilg)	1	also	1	said	1	that	1	"enhanced-community-quarantine"	1	should	1	be	1	considered	1	as	1	a-"total-lockdown.	1	"	1
9933	addition,	1	president-duterte	1	advised	1	local-government-units	1	outside	1	of	3	the-national-capital-region	1	to	1	implement	1	a-community-quarantine	1	in	2	cases	1	where,	1	a-given-level	1	local-government,	1	at-least-two-covid-19-cases	1	are	2	confirmed	1	within	1	a-lower-level	1	local-government	1	jurisdiction;	1	for	1	example,	1	a-province-wide-quarantine	1	should	1	be	1	implemented	1	if	1	there	1	at	1	least	1	two	1
9934	covid-19-cases	1	confirmed	1	within	1	different-cities	1	or	1	municipalities	1	in	1	the-same-province,	1	while	1	a-city/municipality-wide-quarantine	1	should	1	be	1	implemented	1	if	1	there	1	are	1	at	1	least	1	two	1
9935	covid-19-cases	1	confirmed	1	within	1	different-barangays	1	in	1	the-same-city	1	or	1	municipality.	1
9936	local-government	3	has	1	given	1	units	2	under	1	enhanced-community-quarantine	1	in	2	visayas	1	and	2	mindanao	1	relevant-field-offices	1	of	2	the-department	1	health	1	the-power	1	to	1	lift	1	or	1	extend	1	the-lockdown-period	1	jurisdiction.	1
9937	on	1	april	1	6,	1	the-following-localities	1	were	1	under	1	enhanced-community-quarantine:	1	all-regions	1	of	2	luzon,	1	western-visayas,	1	caraga-region,	1	zamboanga-peninsula,	1	samar,	1	biliran,	1	cebu,	1	negros-oriental,	1	camiguin,	1	bukidnon,	1	sultan-kudarat,	1	lanao-del-sur,	1	lanao-del-norte,	1	cotabato,	2	south	1	tawi-tawi,	1	and	1	the-municipality	1	catarman	1	in	1	northern	1	samar.	1
9938	on	2	april	1	24,	1	it	1	was	1	clarified	1	that	1	local-government-units	1	can	1	no	1	longer	1	impose	1	quarantine-measures	1	without	1	the-consent	1	of	1	the-inter-agency-task-force	1	emerging-infectious-diseases	1	(iatf-eid).	1
9939	although	1	exact-measures	2	per	2	level	2	may	1	vary	1	over	1	time	1	due	1	to	1	the-government	2	revising	1	guidelines,	1	the	2	strictest	1	of	1	is	1	the-ecq	1	and	1	most	1	lenient	1	being	1	the-mgcq.	1
9940	ecq	1	was	1	reintroduced	1	in	2	march	1	2021	1	the-greater-manila-area	1	(or	1	ncr	1	plus	1	as	1	designated	1	by	1	the-iatf-eid);	1	new-set	1	of	1	measures	1	were	1	observed.	1
9941	people	2	aged	1	18-years	1	below	1	and	3	above	1	65,	1	with	1	comorbidities,	1	pregnant-women	2	are	1	barred	1	from	1	going	1	out	1	homes	1	except	1	to	2	either	1	obtain	1	essential-goods	1	services	1	or	1	report	1	for	1	work.	1
9942	in	1	addition	1	to	1	front-line-services	1	(health	1	and	1	other-emergency-services);	1	full-operations	1	is	1	allowed	1	for	1	certain-operations	1	including	1	agriculture,-forestry,-aquaculture-and-delivery-and-courier-services	1	of	1	essential-goods.	1
9943	however,	1	with	2	the-ecq-period	1	in	3	march-april	1	2021	1	coinciding	1	the-holy-week	1	and	1	late-release	1	of	4	guidelines	1	the-department	1	transportation,	1	this	1	resulted	1	the-virtual-absence	1	public-transportation	1	some-areas.	1
9944	a-level	1	under	2	gcq,	1	is	1	called	1	a	1	modified	1	general	1	community	1	quarantine	1	(mgcq).sporting	1	activities	1	has	1	been	1	allowed	2	in	1	areas	1	gcq	1	since	1	july	1	2020,	1	although	1	live-spectators	1	are	1	not	1	for	1	sports-events.	1
9945	prior	1	to	1	the-imposition	1	of	1	the-enhanced-community-quarantine	1	in	2	luzon,	1	a-more-lenient-measure,	1	which	1	includes	1	a	2	stay-at-home	1	order	1	and	2	a-curfew,	1	was	2	imposed	1	metro-manila	1	officially	1	called	1	"community	1	quarantine".	1
9946	in	1	may	1	2020,	1	additional-terms	1	were	1	coined	1	by	1	the-government	2	to	2	categorize	1	the-community-quarantine	1	according	1	risk	1	assessment	1	and	2	those-new-terms	1	are	1	"modified-enhanced-community-quarantine,"-"modified-general-community-quarantine"	1	"new	1	normal.	1	"	1
9947	a-"total-lockdown"-measure,	1	distinct	1	from	2	an-ecq,	1	has	1	been	1	considered,	1	which	1	would	1	prohibit	1	people	2	leaving	1	places	1	of	2	residence	1	and	1	mandate	1	the-closure	1	all-public-establishments.	1
9948	according	1	to	1	presidential-spokesperson-harry-roque,	1	a-"total-lockdown"-measure,	1	distinct	1	from	2	an-ecq,	1	has	1	been	1	considered,	1	which	1	would	1	prohibit	1	people	1	leaving	1	their-places	1	of	2	residence	1	and	1	mandate	1	the-closure	1	all-public-establishments	1	is	1	considered	1	as	1	an-option.	1
9949	a-classification	1	of	1	measures	1	called	1	"new	1	normal",	1	a-level	1	under	1	mgcq,	1	was	1	introduced	1	sometime	1	in	1	june	1	2020,	1	but	1	has	1	not	1	yet	1	been	1	used.	1
9950	an-indefinite-enhanced-community-quarantine,	1	was	1	imposed	3	in	2	caraga,	2	alternatively	1	known	1	as	1	one	1	shield	1	started	1	on	2	april	2	7,	1	and	3	the-davao-region	1	which	1	took	1	effect	1	4.provinces	1	that	1	an-enhanced-community-quarantine	1	include	1	iloilo	2	(march	7	21),	2	antique	1	22),	1	negros-occidental	1	30),	3	cebu	2	negros-oriental	1	(april	1	3).the	1	independent	1	cities	1	of	1	bacolod	1	city	2	28)	1	also	1	ecq-measures.	1
9951	on	1	may	2	12,	1	2020,	1	it	1	was	1	originally	1	announced	1	that	1	community-quarantine-measures	1	will	1	be	1	lifted	1	in	1	41-provinces	2	and	2	11-cities	2	across	2	the-country	2	due	1	to	2	being	1	low-risk	1	for	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19),	1	but	1	were	1	eventually	1	upgraded	1	modified-general-community-quarantine	1	(mgcq)	1	after	1	receiving	1	petitions	1	from	1	lgus	1	starting	1	16.on	1

10003	february	1	===	1
10004	on	1	january	1	29,	1	it	1	was	1	announced	1	that	1	the-following-areas	1	will	1	be	1	placed	1	under	1	gcq:	1	the-cordillera-administrative-region	1	and	4	metro-manila,	1	the-provinces	1	of	3	batangas,	1	davao-del-norte,	1	lanao-del-sur,	1	the-cities	1	tacloban,	1	davao-city,	1	iligan	1	for	1	the-whole-month	1	february.	1
10005	the-rest	1	of	1	the-country	1	will	1	be	1	under	1	a-more-lenient-mgcq,	1	unless	1	otherwise	1	stated.	1
10006	on	1	february	1	13,	1	4-barangays	1	in	2	ubay,	1	bohol	1	(bood,	1	fatima,	1	poblacion,	1	and	1	tapon)	1	were	1	placed	1	under	1	mecq	1	due	1	to	1	a-sudden-spike	1	covid-19	1	cases.	1
10007	the-mecq	1	took	1	effect	1	immediately	1	and	1	will	1	stay	1	in	1	place	1	until	1	further-notice.	1
10008	there	1	was	2	a-plan	1	to	2	place	1	the-entire-country	1	under	2	mgcq	1	by	2	march	1	2021,	1	which	1	first	1	proposed	1	the-national-economic-and-development-authority	1	(neda)	1	allow	1	the-reopening	1	of	1	industries	1	closed	1	stricter-quarantine-measures.	1

10010	however,	1	president-rodrigo-duterte	1	issued	1	a-directive	1	against	1	a-plan	1	to	3	place	1	the-entire-country	1	under	2	mgcq	1	by	2	march	1	2021,	1	which	1	was	2	first	1	proposed	1	the-national-economic-and-development-authority	1	(neda)	1	allow	1	the-reopening	1	of	1	industries	1	closed	1	stricter-quarantine-measures	1	but	1	open	1	ease	1	the-restrictions	1	nationwide	1	as	2	soon	1	the-national-government	2	starts	1	vaccination	1	program.	1

10021	the-covid-19-pandemic	1	in	1	the-philippines	1	is	1	part	1	of	2	the-worldwide-pandemic	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	caused	1	by	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
10022	the-first-case	1	in	2	the-philippines	1	was	2	identified	1	on	1	january	1	30,	1	2020	1	and	1	involved	1	a-38-year-old-chinese-woman	1	who	1	confined	1	at	1	san-lazaro-hospital	1	metro-manila.	1
10023	on	1	february	1	1,	1	a	1	posthumous	1	test	1	result	1	from	2	a-44-year-old-chinese-man	1	turned	1	out	1	positive	1	for	1	the-virus,	1	making	1	the-philippines	1	the	1	first	1	country	1	outside	1	china	1	to	1	record	1	a-confirmed-death	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019.	1
10024	after	1	over-a-month	1	without	1	recording	1	any-cases,	1	the-philippines	2	confirmed	1	first-local-transmission	1	on	1	march	1	7,	1	2020.	1
10025	since	1	then,	1	the-virus	1	has	1	spread	1	with	1	at-least-one-case	1	being	1	recorded	1	in	1	the-country's-81-provinces.	1
10026	socio-economic-status	1	has	1	been	1	associated	1	with	1	the-prevalence	1	of	1	covid-19-cases	1	across	1	the-country.	1
10027	lockdowns,	1	or	1	community-quarantines,	1	have	1	been	1	imposed	1	throughout	1	the-country	1	since	1	march	1	15,	1	2020	1	as	1	a-measure	1	to	1	limit	1	the-spread	1	of	1	the-virus.	1

10029	the-largest-single-day-increase	1	in	1	the-number	1	of	2	confirmed-cases	1	was	1	reported	1	on	1	april	1	2,	1	2021,	1	when	1	the-department	1	health	1	(doh)	1	announced	1	15,310-new-cases.	1

10035	january	1	to	1	february	1	2020	1	===	1
10036	the-philippines	2	reported	1	first	1	suspected	1	case	1	of	1	covid-19	1	in	1	january	1	2020.	1
10037	it	1	involved	1	a-5-year-old-boy	1	in	2	cebu,	1	who	1	arrived	1	the-country	1	on	1	january	1	12	1	with	1	the-boy-mother.	1
10038	at	1	that-time,	1	the-philippines	1	had	1	no-capability	1	to	1	conduct	1	covid-19-tests.	1
10039	samples	1	from	1	the-boy	1	were	1	also	1	sent	1	to	2	the-victorian-infectious-disease-reference-laboratory	1	in	1	melbourne,	1	australia	1	determine	1	the-specific-coronavirus-strain.	1
10040	the-boy	1	tested	1	negative	1	for	1	covid-19	1	but	1	several-suspected-cases	1	were	1	already	1	reported	1	in	1	various-parts	1	of	1	the-country.	1

10042	the-ritm-developed-capability	1	to	2	conduct	1	confirmatory-tests	2	for	1	covid-19	3	in	2	response	1	the-emergence	1	of	2	suspected	1	cases	1	started	1	conducting	1	on	2	january-30.the-first-case	1	the-philippines	1	was	1	confirmed	1	the-same-day.	1
10043	the-diagnosed-patient	1	was	1	a-38-year-old-chinese-woman	1	from	2	wuhan,	1	who	1	had	1	arrived	1	in	1	manila	1	hong-kong	1	on	1	january	1	21.	1

10060	retrospective-studies	1	have	1	been	1	made	1	to	1	determine	1	the-strain	1	of	2	virus	1	responsible	1	for	1	causing	1	the-community-outbreak	1	covid-19	1	in	1	the-philippines	1	since	1	march	1	2020.	1

10062	the-virus-strain's-family-tree	1	is	1	said	1	by	1	salvaña	1	to	1	have	1	appeared	1	in	1	china	1	and	1	australia.	1
10063	genetic-sequence-analysis	1	of	3	samples	1	collected	1	from	4	philippine-general-hospital-patients	1	march	1	22–28	1	suggest	1	that	1	there	1	are	1	at-least-two-sources	1	viral-transmission	1	in	1	the-philippines;	1	china,	1	mainly	1	shanghai	1	and	1	japan	1	specifically	1	through	1	repatriated-filipino-seafarers	1	the-diamond-princess-cruise-ship.	1

10075	april	1	to	1	may	1	2020	1	==	1
10076	by	1	april,	1	covid-19	1	had	2	spread	1	to	1	all-17-regions	1	of	3	the-philippines,	1	with	1	the-confirmation	1	a-case	1	in	3	april	1	6	1	a-patient	1	confined	1	at	1	a-hospital	1	surigao-city	1	who	1	been	1	the-caraga-region	1	since	1	march	1	12	1	after	1	traveling	1	from	1	manila.	1
10077	president-duterte	1	on	2	april	3	7	1	accepted	1	the-recommendation	1	of	1	the-inter-agency-task-force	1	emerging-infectious-diseases	1	(iatf-eid)	1	to	1	extend	1	the-ecq	1	in	1	luzon	1	until	1	30.on	1	17	1
10078	,	1	it	1	was	1	reported	1	that	2	the-country	1	had	1	been	1	able	1	to	3	bring	1	down	1	the-viral-disease'-reproduction-number	1	0.65	1	from	2	1.5,	1	which	1	meant	1	the-average-number	1	of	1	people	1	a-person	1	could	1	infect	1	decreased	1	more	1	than	2	one	1	less	1	one.	1
10079	recent-data	1	at	1	the-time	1	suggested	1	that	1	the-country	1	was	2	doing	1	better	1	in	3	"flattening	1	the-curve",	1	but	1	warned	1	of	3	a-"resurgence"	1	and	2	must	1	ramp	1	up	1	mass-testing	1	order	1	to	2	isolate	1	cases	1	avoid	1	further-transmission	1	covid-19.sometime	1	late-april,	1	local-government-units	1	(lgus)	1	were	1	no	1	longer	1	authorized	1	impose	1	quarantine-measures	1	without	1	the-consent	1	the-iatf-eid.	1
10080	prior	1	to	1	that-period,	1	lgus	1	could	1	impose	1	such-measures	1	in	1	coordination	1	with	1	the-department	1	of	1	the-interior-and-local-government.	1
10081	in	1	the-philippines,	1	tens-of-thousands	1	of	2	people	1	who	1	were	2	locked	1	out	1	due	1	to	1	lockdowns	1	faced	1	with	1	the-dual-threat	1	typhoons	1	and	1	viruses,	1	forcing	1	complex-and-dangerous-evacuation.	1
10082	at	1	each-shelter	1	in	2	the-central-part	1	of	3	the-philippines,	1	order	1	to	1	prevent	1	the-spread	1	coronavirus-infection,	1	only-half	1	the-capacity	1	was	2	accepted,	1	and	1	a-mask	1	required	1	when	1	evacuating.	1
10083	by	1	the-time	1	typhoon-vongfong	1	landed,	1	the-number	2	of	2	confirmed-infections	1	was	2	11,618	1	and	1	deaths	1	(due	1	to	1	infectious-diseases)	1	772	1	in	1	the-philippines.	1
10084	the-remaining-parts	1	of	1	the-country	1	were	1	placed	1	under	1	gcq.	1
10085	===	2	june	1	to	1	july	1	2020	1
10086	quarantine-measures	1	raised	1	throughout	1	the-country	1	started	1	to	2	loosen	1	up	1	on	1	june	1	1,	1	with	1	areas	1	formerly	1	under	1	ecq	1	transitioning	1	a-less-strict-quarantine.	1
10087	this	1	led	1	to	1	a-significant-rise	1	in	1	the-number	1	of	1	confirmed-cases,	1	as	1	more-areas	1	implemented	1	a-gcq.	1

10171	testing	1	===	1
10172	early	1	covid-19	1	testing	1	in	1	the-philippines	1	was	1	only	1	limited	1	to	4	persons	1	with	3	travel-history	1	countries	1	cases	1	of	1	local-transmission	1	and	1	those	1	exposure	1	the-individuals	1	confirmed	1	have	1	covid-19.	1
10173	on	1	march	1	30,	1	symptomatic-healthcare-workers	1	are	1	also	1	considered	1	priority	1	for	1	testing.	1
10174	all	2	of	3	those	2	coming	1	from	1	abroad,	1	(3)-all-close-contacts	1	confirmed-cases	1	that	1	were	1	found	1	through	1	contact-tracing,	1	and	1	(4)	1	who	1	tested	1	positive	1	on	1	rapid-antibody-tests.	1
10175	the-government	1	is	2	also	1	opting	1	to	1	test	1	through	1	benchmarks,	1	by	1	testing	1	1–2%	1	of	2	the-philippines'-entire-population	1	and	1	10–12%	1	the-worst-affected-region	1	in	1	the-country,	1	which	1	metro-manila.	1
10176	in	1	late-march	1	2020,	1	some-politicians	1	and	1	their-relatives	1	were	1	reportedly	1	tested	1	for	1	the-disease	2	despite	1	not	1	showing	1	any-symptoms,	1	causing	1	public-backlash	1	amidst	1	a-shortage	1	of	1	testing-kits	1	since	1	was	1	against	1	doh-guidelines	1	to	1	test	1	asymptomatic-individuals.	1
10177	doh-doh	1	responded	1	to	3	the-public-criticism	1	by	1	clarifying	1	that,	1	while	1	there	1	is	1	"no-policy	1	for	2	vip-treatment"	1	with	1	regard	1	testing	1	covid-19	1	and	2	that	1	"all-specimens	1	are	1	being	1	processed	1	on	1	a-first-in,-first-out-basis,"	1	it	1	"extends	1	courtesy"	1	front-line-government-officials,	1	specifically	1	those	1	involved	1	in	1	national-security	1	public-health.	1

10181	the-country	1	has	2	conducted	2	over-3-million-tests	1	as	1	of	2	september	1	2020.on	1	march	1	9,	1	2020,	1	a-total-of-2,000-tests	1	been	1	at	1	a-rate	1	200-to-250-people	1	accommodated	1	by	1	tests	1	per	1	day.	1

10315	after	1	two-months	1	of	1	a-relaxed-gcq-status,	1	a-second-mecq	2	was	2	reimplemented	1	in	1	metro-manila	1	and	2	immediate	1	surrounding	1	provinces	1	on	2	august	2	4	1	lifted	1	18.	1
10316	finally,	1	on	1	january	1	24,	1	2021,	1	a-third-ecq	1	was	2	restored	1	in	3	tabuk	1	while	1	an-a-second-mecq	1	raised	1	four-more-municipalities	1	kalinga.	1
10317	a-third-ecq	1	was	1	lifted	1	on	1	february	1	15.	1
10318	due	1	to	1	a-recent-spike	1	in	2	covid-cases,	1	especially	1	the-greater-manila-area,	1	another-ecq	1	was	1	reimplemented	1	for	1	the-holy-week	1	starting	1	on	1	march	1	29	1	until	2	april	2	4,	1	which	1	has	1	since	1	been	1	extended	1	11,	1	2021.	1
10319	following	1	the-outbreak	1	of	2	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19)	1	which	1	started	1	in	2	wuhan,	2	hubei,	1	china,	1	the-philippine-government	1	confirmed	1	the-country's-first-case	1	the-disease	1	on	1	january	1	30,	1	2020,	1	when	1	the-virus	1	was	1	detected	1	a-chinese-national	1	who	1	traveled	1	from	1	china	1	and	1	hong-kong.	1
10320	the-country's-first-case	1	of	1	the-disease	1	was	1	confirmed	1	on	1	february	1	2,	1	the-patient	1	being	1	the-first-death	1	outside	1	china	1
10321	china	1	was	1	also	1	chinese.	1
10322	three	1	days	1	later,	1	on	1	february	1	5,	1	another-chinese-national	1	was	1	confirmed	1	to	1	the-be-third-case	1	in	1	the-philippines.	1
10323	after	1	a-month,	1	on	1	march	1	5,	1	the-department	1	of	2	health	1	(doh)	1	announced	1	that	1	the-first-filipino	1	in	1	the-philippines	1	confirmed	1	to	1	be	1	infected	1	with	1	covid-19	1	who	1	is	2	also	1	the-fourth-case	1	while	1	the-fifth-case	1	the-first-case	1	local-transmission	1	since	1	the-infected-person	1	did	1	not	1	travel	1	outside	1	the-philippines.	1
10324	the-sixth-case	1	that	1	was	1	confirmed	1	on	1	march	1	7	1	is	1	the-wife	1	of	1	the-fifth-case.	1
10325	in	1	the-following-days,	1	the-number	1	of	1	cases	1	steadily	1	increased.	1
10326	on	1	march	1	8,	1	2020,	1	president-rodrigo-duterte	1	signed	1	proclamation	1	922	1	placing	1	the-entire-philippines	1	under	1	state	1	of	2	public-health-emergency	1	because	1	the-covid-19-threat	1	that	1	is	1	looming	1	in	1	the-nation.	1
10327	on	1	the-next-day,	1	march	1	9,	1	congressman-joey-salceda	1	of	5	the-2nd-district	1	the-province	1	albay	1	recommended	1	a-lockdown	1	the-entire-national-capital-region	1	(ncr)	1	for	1	a-period	1	seven-days,	1	in	2	response	1	to	1	the-covid-19-threat	1	that	1	is	1	looming	1	the-nation.	1
10328	some	1	of	6	congressman-joey-salceda	1	the-2nd-district	1	the-province	1	albay's	1	proposals	1	for	1	implementing	1	the-lockdown	1	include	1	banning	1	mass-transportation	1	and	4	stopping	1	the-operation	1	the-philippine-expressway-network	1	that	1	ply	1	to	1	from	1	the-entire-national-capital-region	1	(ncr),	1	canceling	1	classes	1	work.	1
10329	at	2	first,	1	president-rodrigo-duterte	2	turned	1	down	1	the-idea	2	because	1	would	2	"hamper	1	the-flow	1	of	2	basic-commodities,"	1	although,	1	health	1	secretary	1	francisco	1	duque	1	iii,	1	opined	1	that	3	the-lockdown	1	may	1	put	1	into	1	effect	1	in	1	some-areas	1	where	1	there	1	are	1	reported	1	community-based-transmissions,	1	but	1	not	1	the	1	whole	1	ncr.on	1	march	2	12,	1	announced	1	the-"community-quarantine"	1	metro-manila	1	start	1	12-midnight	1	on	1	15	1	up	1	to	1	april	1	14	1	covers	1	16-cities	1	and	1	one-municipality.	1
10330	traveling	1	through	1	land,	1	domestic-air,	1	and	1	domestic-sea	1	from	1	metro-manila	1	was	1	suspended	1	but	1	with	1	exceptions.	1
10331	for	2	international-travel,	1	restrictions	1	are	1	imposed	1	on	1	those	1	who	1	came	1	from	1	countries	1	with	1	localized-covid-19-transmissions,	1	except	1	citizens	1	of	2	the-philippines	1	(including	1	their-foreign-spouse	1	and	2	children)	1	or	1	holders	1	permanent-resident-visas	1	diplomat-visas.	1

10388	restrictions	1	on	1	the-people's-movement	1	====	1

11324	the-first-lockdown	1	began	1	around	1	21	1	february	1	2020,	1	covering	1	ten-municipalities	1	of	3	the-province	2	lodi	1	in	3	lombardy	1	and	2	one	1	padua	1	veneto,	1	affecting	1	around-50,000-people.	1
11325	early	1	on	1	sunday	1	8	1	march	1	2020,	1	italian-prime-minister-giuseppe-conte	1	announced	1	the-expansion	1	of	3	the-quarantine-zone	1	to	3	cover	1	much	1	northern-italy,	1	affecting	1	over-sixteen-million-people,	1	restricting	1	travel	1	from,	1	or	1	within	1	the-affected-areas,	1	banning	1	funerals	1	and	3	cultural-events,	1	requiring	1	people	1	keep	1	at-least-one-metre	1	distance	1	from	1	one	1	another	1	in	1	public-locations	1	such	1	as	1	restaurants,	1	churches	1	supermarkets.	1

11354	2020	2	malaysia	1	movement	1	control	1	order	1	singapore	1	circuit	1	breaker	1	measures	1	==	1
11355	the-virus	1	was	1	first	1	identified	1	in	2	december	1	2019	1	wuhan,	1	china.	1
11356	the-world-health-organization	1	declared	2	a-public-health-emergency	1	of	1	international-concern	1	regarding	1	covid-19	1	on	2	30-january	1	2020,	1	and	1	later	1	a-pandemic	1	11-march	1	2020.	1
11357	as	1	of	2	29-april	1	2021,	1	more-than-149-million-cases	1	have	1	been	1	confirmed,	1	with	1	more-than-3.15-million-deaths	1	attributed	1	to	1	covid-19,	1	making	1	covid-19	1	one	1	the-deadliest-pandemics	1	in	1	history.	1
11358	symptoms	1	of	1	covid-19	1	are	1	highly	1	variable,	1	ranging	1	from	1	none	1	to	1	life-threateningly	1	severe.	1
11359	transmission	1	of	1	covid-19	1	occurs	1	mainly	1	when	1	an-infected-person	1	is	1	in	1	close-contact	1	with	1	another-person.	1
11360	small-droplets	3	containing	3	the-virus	3	leave	1	an-infected-person	1	as	1	breathe,	1	cough,	1	sneeze,	1	or	2	speak	1	and	1	enter	1	another-person	1	via	1	mouth,	1	nose,	1	eyes.	1
11361	less	1	commonly,	1	the-virus	1	may	1	spread	1	via	1	contaminated-surfaces.	1
11362	people	2	remain	1	contagious	1	for	1	up-to-20-days,	1	and	1	can	1	spread	1	the-virus	1	even	1	if	1	do	1	not	1	develop	1	any-symptoms.	1
11363	recommended-preventive-measures	1	include	1	social-distancing,	1	wearing	1	face-masks	1	in	1	public,	1	ventilation	1	and	3	air-filtering,	1	hand-washing,	1	covering	1	one's-mouth	1	when	1	sneezing	1	or	2	coughing,	1	disinfecting	1	surfaces,	1	monitoring	1	self-isolation	1	for	1	people	1	exposed	1	symptomatic.	1
11364	several-vaccines	1	have	1	been	1	developed	1	and	1	widely	1	distributed	1	since	1	december	1	2020.	1
11365	the-pandemic	1	has	1	resulted	1	in	1	significant-global-social-and-economic-disruption,	1	including	1	the-largest-global-recession	1	since	1	the-great-depression.	1
11366	the-pandemic	1	has	1	led	1	to	1	widespread-supply-shortages	1	exacerbated	1	by	1	panic-buying,	1	agricultural-disruption-and-food-shortages,	1	and	2	decreased	1	emissions	1	of	1	pollutants	1	greenhouse-gases.	1
11367	the-pandemic	1	has	1	raised	1	issues	1	of	1	racial-and-geographic-discrimination,	1	health-equity,	1	and	2	the-balance	1	between	1	public-health-imperatives	1	individual-rights.	1
11368	although	1	the-exact-origin	1	of	1	the-virus	1	is	1	still	1	unknown,	1	the-first-outbreak	1	started	1	in	2	wuhan,	1	hubei,	1	china	1	late	1	2019.	1
11369	many-early-cases	1	of	1	covid-19	1	have	1	been	1	attributed	1	to	1	people	1	who	1	had	1	visited	1	the-huanan-seafood-wholesale-market	1	in	1	wuhan.	1
11370	on	1	11-february	1	2020,	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who)	1	named	1	the-disease	1	"covid-19",	1	which	1	is	1	short	1	for	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019.	1
11371	the-virus	1	that	1	caused	1	the-outbreak	1	is	1	known	1	as	1	severe-acute-respiratory-syndrome-coronavirus	1	2	1
11372	,	1	a-newly-discovered-virus	1	closely	1	related	1	to	1	bat-coronaviruses,	1	pangolin-coronaviruses,	1	and	2	sars-cov.-scientific-consensus	1	is	2	that	2	covid-19	1	a-zoonotic-virus	1	arose	1	from	1	bats	1	in	2	a-natural-setting,	1	although	1	the-exact-original-host	1	cross-species-infection-routes	1	remain	1	need	1	of	1	further-investigation.	1
11373	the-earliest-known-person	2	with	3	symptoms	2	was	1	later	1	discovered	1	to	1	have	2	fallen	1	ill	1	on	1	1-december	1	2019,	1	and	1	did	1	not	1	visible-connections	1	the-later-wet-market-cluster.	1
11374	of	2	the-early-cluster	1	cases	1	reported	1	that	1	month,	1	two-thirds	1	were	1	found	1	to	1	have	1	a-link	1	with	1	the-market.	1
11375	official-case	1	counts	1	refer	1	to	2	the-number	1	of	1	people	1	who	1	have	1	been	2	tested	1	for	1	covid-19	1	and	1	whose-test	1	has	1	confirmed	1	positive	1	according	1	official-protocols.	1
11376	an-analysis	1	of	4	the-early-phase	1	the-outbreak	1	up	1	to	1	23	1	january	1	estimated	1	86-percent	1	covid-19-infections	1	had	1	not	1	been	1	detected,	1	and	1	that	1	these-undocumented-infections	1	were	1	the-source	1	for	1	79-percent	1	documented-cases.	1
11377	on	1	9-april	1	2020,	1	preliminary-results	1	found	1	that	1	15-percent	1	of	2	people	1	tested	2	in	2	gangelt,	1	the-centre	1	a-major-infection-cluster	1	germany,	1	positive	1	for	1	antibodies.	1
11378	screening	1	for	1	covid-19	1	in	3	pregnant-women	1	new-york-city,	1	and	1	blood-donors	1	the-netherlands,	1	has	1	also	1	found	1	rates	1	of	1	positive-antibody-tests	1	that	1	may	1	indicate	1	more-infections	1	than	1	reported.	1
11379	analysis	1	by	1	age	1	in	2	china	1	indicates	1	that	1	a-relatively-low-proportion	1	of	1	cases	1	occur	1	individuals	1	under	1	20.	1
11380	a-retrospective-cohort-study	1	in	1	china	1	found	1	that	1	children	1	and	1	adults	1	were	1	just	1	as	1	likely	1	to	1	be	1	infected.	1
11381	initial-estimates	1	of	2	the-basic-reproduction-number	1	(r0)	1	for	1	covid-19	1	in	1	january	1	were	1	between	1	1.4	1	and	1	2.5,	1	but	1	a-subsequent-analysis	1	concluded	1	that	1	it	1	may	1	be	1	about	1	5.7	1	(with	1	a-95-percent-confidence-interval	1	3.8	1	to	1	8.9).	1
11382	by	1	mid-may	1	2020,	1	the-effective-r	1	was	2	close	1	to	1	or	2	below	1	1.0	1	in	2	many-countries,	1	meaning	1	the-spread	1	of	1	the-disease	1	these-areas	1	at	1	that-time	1	stable	1	decreasing.	1
11383	deaths	1	===	1
11384	official-deaths	1	from	1	covid-19	1	generally	1	refer	1	to	2	people	1	who	1	died	1	after	1	testing	1	positive	1	according	1	protocols.	1
11385	these-counts	1	may	1	ignore	1	deaths	1	of	1	people	1	who	1	die	1	without	1	having	1	been	1	tested.	1
11386	conversely,	1	deaths	1	of	1	people	1	who	1	had	1	underlying-conditions	1	may	1	lead	1	to	1	over-counting.	1
11387	comparisons	1	of	1	statistics	1	for	2	deaths	1	all-causes	1	versus	1	the-seasonal-average	1	indicate	1	excess-mortality	1	in	1	many-countries.	1
11388	this	1	may	1	include	1	deaths	1	due	1	to	1	strained-healthcare-systems	1	and	1	bans	1	on	1	elective-surgery.	1
11389	the-first-confirmed-death	1	was	1	in	1	wuhan	1	on	1	9-january	1	2020.	1
11390	the-first-confirmed-death	1	occurred	1	on	2	1-february	1	in	2	the-philippines,	1	and	1	the-first-reported-death	1	outside	1	asia	1	was	1	the-united-states	1	6-february.	1
11391	more-than-95-percent	1	of	1	the-people	1	who	1	contract	1	covid-19	1	recover.	1
11392	people	1	at	1	the-greatest-risk	1	of	1	mortality	1	from	1	covid-19	1	tend	1	to	2	be	1	those	2	with	2	underlying-conditions,	1	such	1	as	1	a-weakened-immune-system,	1	serious-heart-or-lung-problems,	1	severe-obesity,	1	or	2	the	1	elderly	1	(including	1	individuals	1	age	1	65	1	years	1	older).multiple	1	measures	1	are	1	used	1	quantify	1	mortality.	1
11393	countries	2	like	1	belgium	1	include	2	deaths	1	from	1	suspected-cases	1	of	2	covid-19,	1	regardless	1	whether	1	the-person	1	was	1	tested,	1	resulting	1	in	1	higher-numbers	1	compared	1	to	1	that	1	only-test-confirmed-cases.	1
11394	the	1	death-to-case	1	ratio	1	reflects	1	the-number	2	of	2	deaths	1	attributed	1	to	1	covid-19	1	divided	1	by	1	diagnosed-cases	1	within	1	a-given-time-interval.	1
11395	the-number	1	varies	1	by	1	region.	1
11396	the-centers	1	for	3	disease-control	1	and	2	prevention	1	(cdc)	1	of	1	the-united-states	1	noted	1	that	1	"because	1	laboratory-test-results	1	are	1	not	2	typically	1	reported	1	on	1	death-certificates	1	in	1	the-u.s.,	1	[the-national-center	1	health-statistics	1	(nchs)]	1	is	1	planning	1	to	1	implement	1	u07.2	1	mortality-statistics"	1	that-u07.1	1	would	1	be	1	used	1	"	1
11397	on	1	16-april	1	2020,	1	the-who,	1	in	2	the-who	1	formal	1	publication	1	of	1	the-two-codes,	1	u07.1	2	and	1	u07.2,	1	"recognized	1	that	1	many-countries	1	detail	1	as	2	to	3	the-laboratory-confirmation...	1	will	1	not	1	be	1	reported	1	[and]	1	recommended,	1	for	1	mortality-purposes	1	only,	1	code	2	covid-19	1	provisionally	1	unless	1	it	1	is	1	stated	1	'probable'	1	or	1	'suspected'.	1
11398	it	1	was	1	also	1	noted	1	that	1	the-who	1	"does	1	not	1	distinguish"	1	between	1	infection	1	by	1	sars-cov-2	1	and	1	covid-19.	1
11399	a-crucial-metric	1	in	1	assessing	1	the-severity	1	of	4	a-disease	1	is	2	the-infection-fatality-ratio	1	(ifr),	1	which	1	the-cumulative-number	2	deaths	1	attributed	1	to	1	the-disease	1	divided	1	by	1	infected-individuals	1	(including	1	asymptomatic-and-undiagnosed-infections)	1	as	2	measured	1	or	1	estimated	1	a-specific-date.	1
11400	in	1	april	1	2020,	3	an-ifr-range	1	of	4	0.12–1.08%	1	was	1	derived	1	from	4	non-peer-reviewed-serology-surveys,	1	with	1	the	1	upper	1	bound	1	characterised	1	as	3	much	1	more	1	credible	1	and	2	the-range	1	indicated	1	3	1	to	3	27	1	times	1	deadlier	1	than	1	influenza	1	(0.04%).in	1	june	1	a-peer-reviewed-analysis	1	pre-serology-data	1	mainland-china	1	yielded	1	an-overall-ifr	1	0.66%	1	(with	1	age-bracketed-values	1	ranging	1	0.00161%	1	for	7	0–9-years	1	0.595%	1	50–59-years	1	7.8%	1	>	1	80	1	years).in	1	july	1	the-us-cdc	1	adopted	1	the-ifr	1	a-"more-directly-measurable-parameter	1	disease-severity	1	covid-19"	1	computed	1	an-overall-'best-estimate'	1	planning-purposes	1	the-u.s.	1	0.65%.	1
11401	in	2	august	1	2020,	1	the-who	1	reported	1	serology-testing	1	for	1	three-locations	1	europe	1	(with	1	some-data	1	through	1	2-june)	1

11407	another-metric	1	in	1	assessing	1	death-rate	1	is	2	the-case-fatality-ratio	1	(cfr),	1	which	1	deaths	1	attributed	1	to	1	disease	1	divided	1	by	1	individuals	1	diagnosed	1	to-date.	1

11413	on	1	4-february	1	2020,	1	us	1	secretary	1	of	3	health	1	and	2	human-services	1	alex	1	azar	1	published	1	a-notice	1	declaration	1	under	1	the-public-readiness-and-emergency-preparedness-act	1	for	1	medical-countermeasures	1	against	1	covid-19,	2	covering	1	"any-vaccine,	1	used	1	to	1	treat,	1	diagnose,	1	cure,	1	prevent,	1	or	4	mitigate	1	the-transmission	1	sars-cov-2	1	a-virus	1	mutating	1	therefrom",	1	stating	1	that	1	the-declaration	1	precludes	1	"liability-claims	1	alleging	1	negligence	2	by	2	a-manufacturer	1	in	2	creating	1	a-vaccine,	1	a-health-care-provider	1	prescribing	1	the-wrong-dose,-absent-willful-misconduct".	1
11414	the-declaration	1	is	1	effective	1	in	1	the-united-states	1	through	1	1-october	1	2024.	1
11415	there	1	is	1	no-specific,-effective-treatment	1	or	1	cure	1	for	1	coronavirus-disease	1	2019	1	(covid-19),	1	the-disease	1	caused	1	by	1	the-sars-cov-2-virus.	1
11416	thus,	1	the-cornerstone	1	of	2	management	1	covid-19	1	is	1	supportive-care,	1	which	1	includes	1	treatment	1	to	2	relieve	1	symptoms,	1	fluid-therapy,	1	oxygen-support	1	and	2	prone-positioning	1	as	1	needed,	1	medications	1	or	1	devices	1	support	1	other-affected-vital-organs.	1
11417	most-cases	1	of	1	covid-19	1	are	1	mild.	1
11418	in	1	these,	1	supportive-care	1	includes	1	medication	1	such	1	as	1	paracetamol	1	or	1	nsaids	1	to	1	relieve	1	symptoms	1	(fever,	1	body-aches,	1	cough),	1	proper-intake	1	of	1	fluids,	1	rest,	1	and	1	nasal-breathing.	1
11419	the-u.s.-centers	1	for	1	disease-control	1	and	2	prevention	1	(cdc)	1	recommend	1	that	1	those	2	who	2	suspect	2	they	2	are	2	carrying	2	the-virus	2	isolate	1	at	1	home	1	wear	1	a-face-mask.	1

11422	the-antiviral-remdesivir	3	is	3	available	1	in	1	the-u.s.,	1	canada,	1	australia,	1	and	2	several-other-countries,	1	with	1	varying-restrictions;	1	however,	1	not	1	recommended	1	for	1	people	1	needing	1	mechanical-ventilation,	1	discouraged	1	altogether	1	by	1	the-world-health-organization	1	(who),	1	due	1	to	1	limited-evidence	1	of	1	efficacy.	1
11423	for	3	mitigation	1	to	3	be	4	effective,	1	(a)-chains	1	of	3	transmission	1	must	3	broken	1	as	2	quickly	1	possible	1	through	1	screening	1	and	2	containment,	1	(b)	1	health-care	1	available	1	provide	1	the-needs	1	those-infected,-and-(c)-contingencies	1	in	1	place	1	allow	1	effective-rollout	1	(a)	1	(b).	1
11424	containment	1	is	1	undertaken	1	in	1	the-early-stages	1	of	1	an-outbreak	1	and	2	aims	1	to	2	trace	1	isolate	1	those	1	infected	1	as	2	well	1	introduce	1	other-measures	1	stop	1	the-disease	1	from	1	spreading.	1
11425	when	1	it	1	is	1	no	1	longer	1	possible	1	to	3	contain	1	the-disease,	1	efforts	1	then	1	move	1	the-mitigation-stage:	1	measures	1	are	1	taken	1	slow	1	the-spread	2	and	2	mitigate	1	effects	1	on	1	the-healthcare-system	1	society.	1
11426	suppression	1	requires	1	more-extreme-measures	1	so	1	as	2	to	3	reverse	1	the-pandemic	1	by	1	reducing	1	the-basic-reproduction-number	1	less	1	than	1	1.part	1	of	1	managing	1	an-infectious-disease-outbreak	1	is	1	trying	1	delay	1	and	1	decrease	1	the-epidemic-peak,	1	known	1	flattening	1	the-epidemic-curve.	1
11427	this	1	decreases	1	the-risk	1	of	1	health-services	1	being	1	overwhelmed	1	and	2	provides	1	more-time	1	for	1	vaccines	1	treatments	1	to	1	be	1	developed.	1
